source_text: in the beginning god created the heaven and the earth.
target_text: na kalou, e nai tekitekivu ni ka kecega, sa vakavuna na veilomalagi kei na vuravura.

source_text: and the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. and the spirit of god moved upon the face of the waters.
target_text: na vuravura sa sega ni vakavotukana tu, qai lala talega; na kena butobuto sa titobu sara. na yalo ni kalou sa vakaraica sobu tu mai na dela ni wai.

source_text: and god said, let there be light: and there was light.
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna, "me sa rarama mai, " sa qai dua sara na rarama.

source_text: and god saw the light, that it was good: and god divided the light from the darkness.
target_text: na kalou sa raica na rarama, ka sa vinaka. na kalou sa wasea na rarama mai na butobuto.

source_text: and god called the light day, and the darkness he called night. and the evening and the morning were the first day.
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna, na rarama me siga, kei na butobuto me bogi. na karobo ni yakavi ki na kida ni mataka, sai matai ni siga.

source_text: and god said, let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna, "me dua mada na kabukabu, me wasea na veiwai mai na veiwai. "

source_text: and god made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
target_text: na kalou sa qai cakava na kabukabu, ka sa wasea na wai sa tiko ena ruku ni kabukabu kei na wai ena dela ni kabukabu, sa yaco me vakakina.

source_text: and god called the firmament heaven. and the evening and the morning were the second day.
target_text: na kalou sa vakayacana na kabukabu ni maliwa lala, na lomalagi, sa karobo na yakavi ka sa mataka tale, sai karua ni siga.

source_text: and god said, let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna, "na wai kece ena ruku i lomalagi, me vakasoqoni kece ena dua na vanua, ka me basika mai na vanua mamaca; " sa yaco me vakakina.

source_text: and god called the dry land earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he seas: and god saw that it was good.
target_text: na kalou sa vakayacana na vanua mamaca me vuravura, kei na wai sa vakasoqoni vata tu, me, wasawasa. na kalou sa raica oqo ni sa vinaka.

source_text: and god said, let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
target_text: na kalou sa qai tukuna, "na vanua me vakatubura mai na veico, na veisenikau kei na botebotekoro sa vakasorena, na veivunikau sa vakavuana ena kena veimataqali sa tiko e loma na sorena, " sa yaco me vakakina.

source_text: and the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and god saw that it was good.
target_text: sa tubu mai na veico, na veisenikau, na botebotekoro vakasorena na kena veimataqali, na veivunikau vakavuana sa tiko e loma na sorena ena kena veimataqali. na kalou sa raica ni sa vinaka.

source_text: and the evening and the morning were the third day.
target_text: sa karobo, ka sa mataka tale na i katolu ni siga.

source_text: and god said, let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna tale, "me dua na rarama me tiko mai lomalagi, me wasea na siga mai na bogi, me vakatakilakila ni veiveisau ni veitabadraki kei na veitaba-gauna, vakasiga ka vakayabaki talega;

source_text: and let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
target_text: "me rarama kina na veilomalagi ka me solia mai na rarama e vuravura. " sa yaco me vakakina.

source_text: and god made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
target_text: na kalou sa cakava e rua na rarama levu, na rarama levu me lewa na siga kei na rarama me lewa na bogi. sa bulia talega na veikalokalo.

source_text: and god set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
target_text: na kalou sa vakatikori ira na veirarama oqo ena veiyasana vakalomalagi, me ra solia mai na rarama ki vuravura,

source_text: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and god saw that it was good.
target_text: ka me ra lewa talega na siga kei na bogi, me ra wasea na rarama mai na butobuto. na kalou, ni sa raica oqo, sa vinaka vua.

source_text: and the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
target_text: oqo na karobo ni yakavi kei na mataka, sa i ka va ni siga.

source_text: and god said, let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
target_text: na kalou sa qai tukuna, "me sa levu mai na wai, ka me levu talega mai na vei manumanu bula, me ra sa vuka mai na manumanu vuka e delai vuravura ka vukaca yani na veiyasana vakalomalagi. "

source_text: and god created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and god saw that it was good.
target_text: na kalou sa qai bulia na veimanumanu levu ni waitui kei na veika bula kecega era sinai tu mai na wailevu ena kena veimataqali, na vei manumanu kece vakatabana ena kena veimataqali. na kalou, ni sa raica oqo sa vinaka vua.

source_text: and god blessed them, saying, be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa qai vosa vakalouvinakataka na veika oqo ka tukuna, "mo ni yagavakalevu ka vakavuqataki kemuni ka vakatawana na wai ni wasawasa kei na manumanu vuka me levu sara e vuravura. "

source_text: and the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
target_text: sa qai karobo na yakavi ka mataka tale ni kalima ni siga.

source_text: and god said, let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
target_text: na kalou sa qai tukuna, "o vuravura me kauta mai na veika bula me vaka na kena veimataqali na manumanu yavai va, na veimanumanu kece sa qasi voli, na veimanumanu kila ni veikau, o ira kece oqo kei na kena veimataqali, " sa yaco me vakakina.

source_text: and god made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and god saw that it was good.
target_text: na kalou sa bulia na veimanumanu ni vuravura me vaka na kena veimataqali, na bulumakau, na veika sa qasi voli, na veimanumanu kila ni vanua, me vaka na kedra dui veimataqali. na kalou ni sa raica oqo, sa vinaka dina.

source_text: and god said, let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna, "medatou bulia mada na tamata me vakataki kedatou, me rairai vakataki kedatou, me ra lewa na vei ika kecega mai wai, na veimanumanu vuka e macawa kei na manumanu kecega ni vanua kei na veika kecega sa qasi voli e delai vuravura. "

source_text: so god created man in his own image, in the image of god created he him; male and female created he them.
target_text: na kalou, sa qai bulia na tamata me vakataki koya ga, e nai rairai ga e va-kalou, na kalou sa bulia kina na tamata, na tagane kei na yalewa sa bulia o koya.

source_text: and god blessed them, and god said unto them, be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa vakalouvinakataki rau, ka sa tukuna vei rau, "mo drau yagavakalevu ka vakalewelevutaki kemudrau, me vakatawai o vuravura ka me vakarorogo vei kemudrau; drau lewa na ika mai wai, na manumanu vuka e macawa, kei na veika kecega sa lako voli e delai vuravura. "

source_text: and god said, behold, i have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna, "raica, au sa solia vei kemudrau na veico kei na veika sa tubu mai ena qele, ka vakasorena tiko kei na vei vunikau vakavuana sa tiko e loma na sorena, oqori me kakana.

source_text: and to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, i have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
target_text: "na vei manumanu kece ni veikau kei na manumanu vuka ni macawa kei na veika kecega sa qasi voli e vuravura ka bula tiko, au sa solia vei ira na co kei na botebotekoro kecega sa tubu mai me kedra kakana; " sa yaco me vakakina.

source_text: and god saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. and the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
target_text: na kalou, ni sa raica na veika kece sa cakava oti, io, sa dina, sa vinaka sara. sa qai karobo na yakavi ka mataka ni ka ono ni siga.

source_text: thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
target_text: na veilomalagi kei na vuravura, kei na ka kecega sa tiko kina, sa buli oti.

source_text: and on the seventh day god ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
target_text: ena i kavitu ni siga, sa mai oti kina na nona cakacaka na kalou. sa vakacegu ena i kavitu ni siga na kalou mai na nona cakacaka kecega ni veibuli sa cakava oti.

source_text: and god blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which god created and made.
target_text: na kalou sa qai vakalouvinakataka nai kavitu ni siga ka vakatabuya, baleta ni sa vakacegu mai na nona cakacaka kecega sa cakava ka bulia na kalou.

source_text: these are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the lord god made the earth and the heavens,
target_text: oqo nai tukutuku ni veigauna kei lomalagi kei vuravura, ena gauna rau sa buli kina, ena siga sa bulia kina na lomalagi kei na vuravura na kalou o jiova,

source_text: and every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the lord god had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.
target_text: ni se bera ni tubu mai e dua na kau ena vanua se, e dua na co me tubu mai. na kalou o jiova e se bera ni vakavuna me tau mai na uca ki vuravura, ka e se bera ni tiko e dua na tamata me vakarautaka na qele;

source_text: but there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
target_text: sa lako cake ga mai na tegu mai vuravura ka vakasuasuataka na qele taucoko.

source_text: and the lord god formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa bulia na tamata mai na kuvu ni soso mai na qele ka solia nai cegu ni bula ki na ucuna; sa qai yaco me dua na ka bula na tamata.

source_text: and the lord god planted a garden eastward in eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tea e dua nai teitei ena tokalau kei iteni, sa qai vakatikora e kea na tamata sa bulia oti.

source_text: and out of the ground made the lord god to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
target_text: mai na qele, na kalou o jiova sa vakatubura mai kina na kau kecega sa vinaka ni laurai, ka sa vinaka talega ni laukana. na vunikau ni bula sa tiko talega ena loma ni teitei kei na vunikau talega sa kilai kina na vinaka kei na ca.

source_text: and a river went out of eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.
target_text: e dua na uciwai sa drodro mai iteni me vakasuasuataka na i teitei. mai iteni ga sa wase va mai kina na uciwai oqo.

source_text: the name of the first is pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of havilah, where there is gold;
target_text: nai matai ni uciwai o pisoni, sa drodro yani ena vanua taucoko o avila, na vanua sa tiko kina na koula.

source_text: and the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
target_text: na koula ni vanua oqo sa rui vinaka. na vatu talei, na onikisa sa tu e kea.

source_text: and the name of the second river is gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of ethiopia.
target_text: na yaca ni karua ni uciwai o kioni; oqo e curuma yani na vanua taucoko o kusi.

source_text: and the name of the third river is hiddekel: that is it which goeth toward the east of assyria. and the fourth river is euphrates.
target_text: nai katolu ni uciwai o itekeli, na uciwai oqo sa lako yani vaka ki asiria. na i ka va ni uciwai na uferetisi.

source_text: and the lord god took the man, and put him into the garden of eden to dress it and to keep it.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa kauta na tamata ka biuti koya ena i teitei mai iteni me qarava ka maroroya.

source_text: and the lord god commanded the man, saying, of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa vakarota na tamata ka vaka: "na veika kece sa tiko ena i teitei oqo mo kana mai kina;

source_text: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.
target_text: "ia na vunikau ga ni kila na ka vinaka kei na ka ca, mo kua ni kania, na siga o na kania kina na vuana, o na mate dina. "

source_text: and the lord god said, it is not good that the man should be alone; i will make him an help meet for him.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tukuna, "sa sega ni vinaka vua na tamata me tiko duadua. au na cakava e dua na nonai i vukevuke me vakatautauvatataki kei koya. "

source_text: and out of the ground the lord god formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa bulia mai na qele na manumanu kecega ni vanua kei na manumanu vuka ni macawa ka kauta mai vei atama me raica se ena kacivi ira vakacava. na yaca ga sa kacivi ira kina o atama, sa yacadra sara ga.

source_text: and adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for adam there was not found an help meet for him.
target_text: o atama sa vakayacani ira kece na manumanu yavai va kei na manumanu vuka kecega kei na manumanu kecega ni vanua. ia me baleti atama, sa sega ni kune e dua me tautauvata kei koya me rawa ni dau veivuke vua.

source_text: and the lord god caused a deep sleep to fall upon adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa vakavuna e dua na moce bi vei atama ka sa moce lutu sara kina. na kalou sa taura mai e dua na sui ni sarisarina ka ubia vinaka tale na lewena.

source_text: and the rib, which the lord god had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa vakayagataka na sui nei atama me bulia kina na yalewa, ka sa kauta sara mai vua na tamata.

source_text: and adam said, this is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called woman, because she was taken out of man.
target_text: sa tukuna sara o atama: "oqo na sui mai na suiqu, na lewe mai na lewequ, sa na yalewa o koya, baleta ni a wasei mai vua na tagane. "

source_text: therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
target_text: oqo, na vuna, ena biuta kina na tamana kei na tinana na tagane ka sema vei yalewa (watina), me rau sa yago vata.

source_text: and they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
target_text: e rau sa luvawale ruarua tu na tagane kei na watina, e rau sa sega ni madua kina.

source_text: now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the lord god had made. and he said unto the woman, yea, hath god said, ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
target_text: na gata sa dauveivakaisini sara, mai vei ira kecega na manumanu ni vanua sa bulia na kalou o jiova. na gata sa tukuna vua na yalewa ka vaka: "sa tukuna dina na kalou, 'mo drau kua ni kana mai na vunikau kecega sa tu ena i teitei'? "

source_text: and the woman said unto the serpent, we may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:
target_text: sa tukuna mai na yalewa vua na gata, "keirau na kana mai na kau kecega sa tu ena i teitei;

source_text: but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, god hath said, ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
target_text: "ia, na vuanikau mai na vunikau ga sa tiko e na loma donu ni teitei, sa tukuna na kalou, 'mo drau kakua ni kania, se mo drau tara, de drau mate. '"

source_text: and the serpent said unto the woman, ye shall not surely die:
target_text: sa tukuna mai na gata vua na yalewa, "drau na sega dina ni mate.

source_text: for god doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
target_text: "ni sa kila na kalou, mai na siga drau na kania kina, ena rai na matamudrau, drau na vakatalega na kalou ena nomudrau kila na veika vinaka kei na veika ca. "

source_text: and when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.
target_text: na yalewa, ni sa raica na vunikau, ni sa vinaka me kakana, ka sa vinaka talega ki na mata, sa domona talega na vunikau me vuku kina, sa tauca sara na vuana ka kania. sa solia talega vei watina e rau sa tiko vata, sa kana talega o tagane.

source_text: and the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
target_text: sa qai rai na matadrau, ka rau sa kila ni rau sa luvawale ruarua. e rau sa cula vata na drau ni lolo me nodrau i sulu.

source_text: and they heard the voice of the lord god walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the lord god amongst the trees of the garden.
target_text: e rau sa qai rogoca na rorogo ni nona veilakoyaki voli na kalou o jiova ena loma ni teitei ena batabata vinaka ni siga, ka rau sa vunitaki rau mai na mata ni kalou o jiova ena veivunikau ni teitei.

source_text: and the lord god called unto adam, and said unto him, where art thou?
target_text: sa kaci yani na kalou o jiova vei atama ka vaka: "o sa tiko e vei? "

source_text: and he said, i heard thy voice in the garden, and i was afraid, because i was naked; and i hid myself.
target_text: sa sauma mai o atama ka vaka: "au sa rogoca na domomuni e nai teitei, ka au sa rere vakalevu baleta ni'u sa luvawale tu, au sa qai vuni. "

source_text: and he said, who told thee that thou wast naked? hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof i commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa taro tale mai, "o cei e tukuna ni o sa luvawale tu? o sa kana beka mai na vunikau, au a vakarota vei iko mo kua ni kana mai kina? "

source_text: and the man said, the woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and i did eat.
target_text: sa sauma mai na tamata, "na yalewa ga o ni a solia mai vei au me keirau tiko vata, o koya ga sa solia mai vei au na vua ni vunikau oqo, au sa kania sara. "

source_text: and the lord god said unto the woman, what is this that thou hast done? and the woman said, the serpent beguiled me, and i did eat.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tukuna vua na yalewa, "na cava sara mada oqo, o sa cakava? " sa sauma na yalewa ka vaka: "sa vakaisini au na gata, ka, au sa kana sara. "

source_text: and the lord god said unto the serpent, because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tukuna vua na gata: "baleta na veika o sa cakava oqo, o sa rukaki vakalevu cake kina mai vei ira na manumanu ni vanua; o na lako voli e ketemu, o na kania na kuvu ni qele ena veisiga kece o sa bula kina.

source_text: and i will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
target_text: au na vaka veimecakitaki iko kei na yalewa, o ira na nomu kawa kei na nona kawa; o koya ena vakamavoataka na ulumu, ka o na vakamavoataka na bukubuku ni yavana. "

source_text: unto the woman he said, i will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tukuna talega vua na yalewa; "au na vakalevutaka vei iko na rarawa ena gauna ni nomu kunekune; ena mosi levu, o na vakasucuma mai kina na gone; na nomu gagadre sa na tiko ga vua na watimu, ka ena vakatulewa tiko ga vei iko o koya. "

source_text: and unto adam he said, because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which i commanded thee, saying, thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tukuna vakaoqo vei atama, "baleta ni o sa vakarorogo ki na domo i watimu, ka o sa kana mai na vunikau au a vakarota vei iko ka vaka, 'mo kua ni kana mai kina': "sa rukaki na qele ena vukumu; o na buno ka oca ni o sa kana mai kina, ena veisiga kece ni nomu bula.

source_text: thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;
target_text: na co kei na kau vakavotona sa na basika mai ena vukumu, o na kania na botebotekoro era na tubu mai.

source_text: in the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
target_text: ena buno ni yadremu, o na qai kana madrai kina me yacova ni o sa lesu tale ki na qele, baleta ni o a kau ga mai na qele. ni o a kuvu ni soso ga, o na lesu tale ki na kuvu ni soso. "

source_text: and adam called his wife's name eve; because she was the mother of all living.
target_text: o atama sa kacivi na watina me o ivi, ni sa tinadra na bula.

source_text: unto adam also and to his wife did the lord god make coats of skins, and clothed them.
target_text: vei atama kei watina talega, sa cakava kina na kalou o jiova na kuli ni manumanu ka vakaisulutaki rau kina.

source_text: and the lord god said, behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:
target_text: na kalou o jiova sa tukuna, "raica na tamata sa vakataki kedatou, me kila na vinaka kei na ca. oqo de qai taura talega na vua ni kau ni bula, ka kania, ena qai bula ka sega ni mudu"

source_text: therefore the lord god sent him forth from the garden of eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.
target_text: o koya oqo, sa vakatalai koya tani kina na kalou mai na nona i teitei mai iteni, me la'ki cukicuki ka teitei ki na vanua sa kau kina.

source_text: so he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of eden cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.
target_text: sa vakatalai tani na tamata mai iteni ka sa vakatikora na jerupi ena tokalau ni teitei mai iteni kei na seleiwau yameyame ni bukawaqa sa veigoleyaki voli me rau yadrava na vunikau ni bula.

source_text: and adam knew eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare cain, and said, i have gotten a man from the lord.
target_text: o atama sa curumi ivi, ka sa mani kunekune sara o ivi, ka vakasucumi keni ka tukuna, "au sa rawata e dua na tagane mai vei jiova. "

source_text: and she again bare his brother abel. and abel was a keeper of sheep, but cain was a tiller of the ground.
target_text: sa vakasucu tale, oqo sa sucu o epeli na tacina. o epeli sa dau vakaraici ira na sipi, o keni sa dau teitei ena vanua.

source_text: and in process of time it came to pass, that cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the lord.
target_text: ni sa toso tiko na gauna, sa qai yaco me kauta mai o keni e so na i soro vuata ni vanua vei jiova.

source_text: and abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. and the lord had respect unto abel and to his offering:
target_text: o epeli talega sa kauta mai na ulumatua ni nona sipi kei na kedra uro me i soro. o jiova, sa doka vakalevu nai soro nei epeli,

source_text: but unto cain and to his offering he had not respect. and cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
target_text: sa sega ni taleitaki keni kei na nona i soro. sa cudru sara vakalevu o keni ka sa duatani mai na kena i rairai.

source_text: and the lord said unto cain, why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
target_text: o jiova sa qai vosa vei keni ka vaka: "na cava o via cudru kina? na cava na vuna sa duatani kina nai rairai ni matamu?

source_text: if thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. and unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.
target_text: "kevaka o sa caka vinaka, o na sega beka ni ciqomi? ia, kevaka o sega ni caka vinaka, sa wawa tiko nai valavala ca mai na mata ni katuba. sa tiko na nona gagadre vei iko, ia, mo lewa vinaka ga ena vukuna. "

source_text: and cain talked with abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that cain rose up against abel his brother, and slew him.
target_text: e rau sa dau veivosaki o keni kei epeli na tacina; sa yaco na gauna ni rau sa tiko e na vanua, sa tucake o keni ka sa yalocataki epeli na tacina ka vakamatei koya.

source_text: and the lord said unto cain, where is abel thy brother? and he said, i know not: am i my brother's keeper?
target_text: sa taro mai o jiova vei keni, "e vei o epeli na tacimu? " sa sauma mai, "au sa sega ni kila, oi au beka na nonai vakatawa? "

source_text: and he said, what hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o jiova, "na cava o sa cakava, na domo ni dra i tacimu sa tagi tiko mai vei au mai na qele.

source_text: and now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;
target_text: "oqo o sa vakaloucataki mai vuravura, ni sa dolava na gusuna me ciqoma na dra i tacimu mai na ligamu.

source_text: when thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.
target_text: "ni o sa tea na qele, ena sega ni solia na nona taucoko vei iko. o na tamata dauvakacudrui rawarawa ka o na dau veilakoyaki tu ga e vuravura. "

source_text: and cain said unto the lord, my punishment is greater than i can bear.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o keni vei jiova, "na kequ i totogi sa rui levu sara ka sa rui bibi!

source_text: behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall i be hid; and i shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.
target_text: "sa dina sara, o ni sa vakasavi au ena siga oqo mai na matamuni; au na tamata sevaki ka dauveitosoyaki tu ga e vuravura, ena yaco na tamata kecega sa raici au ena via vakamatei au. "

source_text: and the lord said unto him, therefore whosoever slayeth cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. and the lord set a mark upon cain, lest any finding him should kill him.
target_text: sa tukuna vua o jiova, "o koya sa vakamatei keni, ena vakasukai vua me vakavitu tale. " o jiova sa vakatakilakilataki keni, de qai dua e kunei koya ka vakamatea.

source_text: and cain went out from the presence of the lord, and dwelt in the land of nod, on the east of eden.
target_text: sa lako tani o keni mai na mata i jiova, ka la'ki tiko ena vanua o noti, ena ra kei iteni.

source_text: and cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, enoch.
target_text: sa curu vei watina o keni, ka sa kunekune sara o watina, ka qai vakasucumi inoke. sa tara sara e dua na koro o keni ka vakayacana na koro o ya vei luvena gaâ€ o inoke.

source_text: and unto enoch was born irad: and irad begat mehujael: and mehujael begat methusael: and methusael begat lamech.
target_text: mai vei inoke, sa basika mai kina o irati, o meujaeli, o lemeki mai vei metuisela.

source_text: and lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was adah, and the name of the other zillah.
target_text: o lemeki sa rua na watina, e dua o ada kei na kena i karua o sila.

source_text: and adah bare jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.
target_text: o ada sa vakasucumi jabali, o koya oqo na tamadra na dau vakavale laca tuga ka ra dau susu manumanu talega.

source_text: and his brother's name was jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
target_text: na tacina o jubali. o koya oqo na tamadra na dauvakatagi api kei na bitu uvuci.

source_text: and zillah, she also bare tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of tubalcain was naamah.
target_text: vei sila sa sucu kina o tubale-keni na kena dau ni matai ni varasa kei na kaukamea. sa dua na gane i tubale-keni, na yacana o naema.

source_text: and lamech said unto his wives, adah and zillah, hear my voice; ye wives of lamech, hearken unto my speech: for i have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.
target_text: sa tukuna o lemeki vei rau na watina, "kemudrau o ada kei sila, drau rogoci au na wati lemeki, drau rogoca na domoqu! au sa vakamatea e dua na tamata ni a vakamavoataki au, io, e dua na cauravou ni a vakararawataki au.

source_text: if cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly lamech seventy and sevenfold.
target_text: kevaka sa saumi vei keni me vakavitu, vei lemeki me vakavitusagavulu na vitu. "

source_text: and adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name seth: for god, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of abel, whom cain slew.
target_text: sa curumi watina tale o atama, ka sa vakasucuma vua e dua na gone e tagane, ka sa vakayacani koya me o seci, "ni o jiova na kalou sa solia tale vei au e dua mei sosomi kei epeli, o koya sa vakamatea o keni. "

source_text: and to seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name enos: then began men to call upon the name of the lord.
target_text: mai vei seci, sa vakasucumi vua e dua na gone ka tagane na yacana o inosi. oqo na vanua sa vakatekivu kina vei ira na tamata me ra kaciva kina na yaca i jiova.

source_text: this is the book of the generations of adam. in the day that god created man, in the likeness of god made he him;
target_text: oqo nai vola i tukutuku ni kawa vaka-atama. na kalou, ena siga sa bulia kina na tamata, sa cakava me veiucui vata kei na kalou.

source_text: male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name adam, in the day when they were created.
target_text: sa bulia na tagane kei na yalewa na kalou ka vosa vakalouvinakataki rau ka vakatokai rau me tamata mai na siga rau sa buli kina.

source_text: and adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name seth:
target_text: sa bula tiko o atama me dua na drau tolusagavulu na yabaki ka sa vakasucumi vua e dua na gone, e tagane sa vakataki koya ga, me rau veiucui, na yacana o seci.

source_text: and the days of adam after he had begotten seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o seci, sa bula tale tiko o atama me walu na drau na yabaki. sa qai sucu tale eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days that adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.
target_text: na veisiga kece nei atama, sa ciwa na drau tolusagavulu na yabaki, ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat enos:
target_text: sa yabaki dua na drau ka lima o seci, sa qai vakasucumi vua o inosi.

source_text: and seth lived after he begat enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni oti na sucu nei inosi, sa bula tale tiko o seci me walu na drau ka vitu na yabaki. sa vakasucumi tale eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
target_text: na veisiga taucoko nei seci sa ciwa na drau tinikarua na yabaki, ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and enos lived ninety years, and begat cainan:
target_text: sa yabaki ciwasagavulu o inosi qai vakasucumi vua o keinana.

source_text: and enos lived after he begat cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o keinana, sa bula tiko o inosi me walu na drau tinikalima na yabaki, ka sa sucu talega eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
target_text: sa mate o inosi, ni sa ciwa na drau kalima na yabaki ni nona bula.

source_text: and cainan lived seventy years, and begat mahalaleel:
target_text: sa yabaki vitusagavulu o keinana, ni sa sucu o maelalieli.

source_text: and cainan lived after he begat mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: sa vakasucumi vei keinana o maelalieli, sa yabaki walu na drau vasagavulu o keinana ka sa vakasucumi talega vua e so na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
target_text: na yabaki ni bula taucoko nei keinani sa ciwa na drau ka tini na yabaki ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat jared:
target_text: sa yabaki onosagavulu ka lima tiko o maelalieli, sa qai vakasucumi vua o jareti.

source_text: and mahalaleel lived after he begat jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o jareti, sa bula tiko o maelalieli me walu na drau tolusagavulu na yabaki ka sa sucu tale eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
target_text: na yabaki ni bula nei maelalieli e walu nadrau ciwasagavulu ka lima na yabaki, ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat enoch:
target_text: sa bula o jareti me yabaki dua na drau onosagavulu ka rua sa qai sucu o inoke na luvena.

source_text: and jared lived after he begat enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o inoke sa bula tale tiko o jareti me walu na drau na yabaki ka sa sucu tale eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.
target_text: na veisiga kece nei jareti sa ciwa na drau onosagavulu karua na yabaki ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat methuselah:
target_text: o inoke, sa yabaki onosagavulu ka lima ni sa vakasucumi vua o mecusela.

source_text: and enoch walked with god after he begat methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa vakasucumi oti vua o mecusela, sa kune vua, ni rau sa daulako vata kei na kalou me tolu na drau na yabaki, ka sa vakasucumi talega vua na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
target_text: na veisiga kece nei inoke sa tolu na drau onosagavulu ka lima na yabaki.

source_text: and enoch walked with god: and he was not; for god took him.
target_text: sa daulako vata kei na kalou o inoke; ka sa yali eke, ni sa kauti koya na kalou.

source_text: and methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat lamech:
target_text: sa yabaki dua na drau walusagavulu ka vitu o mecusela ni sa vakasucumi vua o lemeki.

source_text: and methuselah lived after he begat lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o lemeki, sa bula tale tiko o mecusela me vitu na drau walusagavulu ka rua na yabaki, ka sa sucu tale e so na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.
target_text: na veisiga kece ni bula nei mecusela sa ciwa na drau onosagavulu ka ciwa na yabaki, ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:
target_text: o lemeki sa yabaki dua na drau walusagavulu karua ni sa vakasucumi vua e dua na luvena tagane.

source_text: and he called his name noah, saying, this same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the lord hath cursed.
target_text: sa vakayacani koya me o noa, ni sa tukuni, "o koya oqo ena vakacegui keda mai na noda oca kei na cakacaka ni ligada, ena vuku ni qele sa rukaka oti o jiova. "

source_text: and lamech lived after he begat noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o noa, sa bula tale tiko o lemeki me lima na drau ciwasagavulu ka lima na yabaki, ka sa sucu tale kina eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and all the days of lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
target_text: na veisiga kece nei lemeki sa vitu na drau vitusagavulu kavitu na yabaki ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: and noah was five hundred years old: and noah begat shem, ham, and japheth.
target_text: sa yabaki lima na drau o noa, ni ratou sa sucu o semi, o ame, kei jevica.

source_text: and it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
target_text: sa qai yaco ni ra sa lewe levu mai na tamata e dela i vuravura, sa levu talega na luvedra yalewa,

source_text: that the sons of god saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
target_text: o ira na luve ni kalou, ni ra sa raici ira na luvedra yalewa na tamata, ni ra sa rui totoka; era sa tauri ira me watidra, o ira kecega era sa digitaka.

source_text: and the lord said, my spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.
target_text: sa qai tukuna o jiova, "na yaloqu ena sega ni veicoqacoqa tikoga kei na tamata me sega ni mudu, baleta ni sa vakayago na tamata; na nona veisiga sa na dua na drau ruasagavulu ga na yabaki. "

source_text: there were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of god came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.
target_text: era sa tu e vuravura ena gauna o ya, na tuwawa, era sa dau lako mai na luve ni kalou ka veidauci kei ira na luvedra yalewa na tamata, era sa mani sucu kina na gone. oqo, o ira na tamata kaukauwa ka kilai ena gauna o ya.

source_text: and god saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
target_text: o jiova, ni sa qai raica na vakasisila ni tamata ni sa rui sivia e vuravura, na nakinaki kei na vakanananu ni yalo ni tamata, sa caca tikotikoga.

source_text: and it repented the lord that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
target_text: sa veivutunitaka sara ga o jiova ena nona a bulia na tamata e vuravura, ka sa rarawa vakalevu kina na yalona.

source_text: and the lord said, i will destroy man whom i have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that i have made them.
target_text: sa tukuna kina vaka oqo, o jiova, "au na vakarusa na tamata mai na delai vuravura, o koya au a bulia, kecekece, na tamata, na manumanu, na veika era qasi voli kei na manumanu vuka ni macawa, ni'u sa rarawataka sara ga, na noqu a buli ira. "

source_text: but noah found grace in the eyes of the lord.
target_text: o noa duaduaga sa kune loloma ena mata i jiova.

source_text: these are the generations of noah: noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and noah walked with god.
target_text: oqo nai tukutuku ni bula nei noa. o noa sa tamata dodonu ka sega ni cala ena nona i tabatamata. sa dau lako vata kei na kalou o noa.

source_text: and noah begat three sons, shem, ham, and japheth.
target_text: sa vakasucumi vei noa e tolu na luvena tagane: o semi kei ame kei jevica.

source_text: the earth also was corrupt before god, and the earth was filled with violence.
target_text: sa ca ka vakacacani vakalevu o vuravura ena mata i jiova, o vuravura sa sinai talega ena i valavala kaukauwa e ca sara.

source_text: and god looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa rai yani ki vuravura, ka raica, ni sa ca dina na kena i tuvaki, ni ra sa ca na tamata kecega kei na nodra i valavala kecega, e delai vuravura.

source_text: and god said unto noah, the end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, i will destroy them with the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa qai tukuna vei noa, "nai tinitini ni ka kecega e vakayago, sa lako cake mai vei au oqo, ni ra sa vakasinaiti vuravura ena veika e kaukauwa ca; raica, au na vakarusai ira vata kei na vuravura.

source_text: make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
target_text: "mo cakava vei iko e dua na waqa kau, cakava e loma ni waqa na veirumu, botana na loma ni waqa ena kuluta, e tuba talega.

source_text: and this is the fashion which thou shalt make it of: the length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
target_text: "mo cakava vaka oqo: na balavu ni waqa me va na drau limasagavulu na fiti, na kena raraba me vitusagavulu ka lima na fiti kei na kena cere me vasagavulu ka lima na fiti.

source_text: and, behold, i, even i, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.
target_text: "mo kila, oi au na kauta mai na waluvu levu e vuravura, me vakarusai kina na yago vakalewe kece e ruku i lomalagi, sa tiko vei ira na i cegu ni bula, kei na ka kecega sa bula e vuravura, e na mate.

source_text: but with thee will i establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons' wives with thee.
target_text: "ia, au na tekivuna na noqu veiyalayalati kei iko â€œo na curu ki waqa, o iko, o iratou na luvemu tagane, o na watimu, kei iratou na dui watina na luvemu.

source_text: and of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
target_text: "na veika bula kece, me kau mai e rua na kena mataqali ki na waqa, me ra bula tiko vata kei iko, me dua e ka tagane kei na dua na ka yalewa.

source_text: of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
target_text: "o ira na manumanu vuka na kena veimataqali, na manumanu yavaiva ena kena veimataqali, na veika sa qasi voli ena kena veimataqali, me ra lako yaya rua mai, me ra maroroi me ra bula.

source_text: and take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.
target_text: "mo kauta mai vei iko na kakana kecega e laukana, mo kumuna vei iko na kakana kei na kedra talega na manumanu. "

source_text: thus did noah; according to all that god commanded him, so did he.
target_text: sa cakava o noa, me vaka sa vakarota vua o jiova, sa cakava vaka kina.

source_text: and the lord said unto noah, come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have i seen righteous before me in this generation.
target_text: o jiova, sa qai vosa vei noa ka vaka: "curu mai ki waqa, o iko, kei iratou na nomu vuvale, baleta ni, au sa raica ni o sa yalododonu e mataqu e na i tabatamata oqo.

source_text: of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.
target_text: "mo kauta vata kei iko e vitu na manumanu savasava mai na veimanumanu kecega, na ka tagane kei na ka yalewa, me rua na kena mataqali sa sega ni savasava, na ka tagane kei na ka yalewa;

source_text: of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
target_text: "me vakatalega kina na manumanu vuka, na kena ka tagane kei na kena ka yalewa, me rawa ni ra bula tiko na kena kawa e delai vuravura.

source_text: for yet seven days, and i will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that i have made will i destroy from off the face of the earth.
target_text: "sa vo tale tiko oqo e vitu na siga, me'u na vakavuna na uca ki vuravura me vasagavulu na siga ka vasagavulu na bogi; ka au na vakawabokotaka kina mai vuravura na ka bula kecega au a bulia. "

source_text: and noah did according unto all that the lord commanded him.
target_text: sa cakava kecega o noa me vaka sa vakarota vua o jiova.

source_text: and noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
target_text: sa yabaki ono na drau o noa ena gauna sa waluvu kina o vuravura.

source_text: and noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
target_text: o noa kei iratou na luvena tagane, kei na watina, kei iratou na vugona yalewa, era sa lako kece ki loma ni waqa, baleta ni sa levu mai na wai ni waluvu.

source_text: of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,
target_text: na manumanu savasava kei na kena e sega ni savasava, na manumanu vuka talega kei na kena era qasi voli,

source_text: there went in two and two unto noah into the ark, the male and the female, as god had commanded noah.
target_text: era sa curu yarurua ki na waqa vei noa, na ka yalewa kei na ka tagane, me vaka sa vakarota o

source_text: and it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
target_text: ni sa oti e vitu na siga na wai ni waluvu sa robota tu na vuravura.

source_text: in the six hundredth year of noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.
target_text: e nai ka ono na drau ni yabaki ni bula nei noa, e nai karua ni vula, nai ka tinikavitu ni siga, ena siga o ya sa kabasu mai kina nai vurevure ni wai titobu kecega, kei na katuba lalai kecega ni lomalagi sa tadola mai.

source_text: and the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
target_text: sa tau tiko na uca e vuravura me vasagavulu na siga ka vasagavulu na bogi.

source_text: in the selfsame day entered noah, and shem, and ham, and japheth, the sons of noah, and noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;
target_text: oqori, na siga sara ga e ratou sa curu kina ki waqa, o noa kei iratou na luvena tagane, kei watina kei iratou na vugona -

source_text: they, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.
target_text: o iratou, kei ira kece na manumanu na kena veimataqali, na bulumakau kece kei na kena veimataqali, na veika kece sa qasi voli e delai vuravura kei na veimataqali manumanu vuka kecega.

source_text: and they went in unto noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein is the breath of life.
target_text: era sa lako ki na waqa vei noa, yarurua kei na ka kecega sa tiko e ucuna nai cegu ni bula.

source_text: and they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as god had commanded him: and the lord shut him in.
target_text: o ira kece sa curu ki waqa, na ka tagane kei na ka yalewa â€œera sa curu ki waqa me vaka sa vakarota vei noa na kalou; o jiova sa sogolati noa talega e loma.

source_text: and the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.
target_text: na waluvu sa tiko e vuravura me vasagavulu na siga. sa tubu cake tikoga na wai ka sa ciri na waqa, sa ciri sara tiko e cake mai na delai vuravura.

source_text: and the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.
target_text: sa tubu cake tikoga vakalevu na wai ena delai vuravura, ka sa veitosoyaki tiko na waqa ena dela ni wai.

source_text: and the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.
target_text: sa tubu cake tikoga na wai, ka sa vakalevu sara ni ra sa luvu kece na vei delana cecere ena ruku i lomalagi.

source_text: fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.
target_text: sa tubu tikoga na wai me sivia e ruasagavulu ka rua na fiti na dela ni veiulunivanua cecere.

source_text: and all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:
target_text: era sa mate na ka bula kecega era sa veilakoyaki voli e vuravura: na manumanu vuka, na bulumakau, na manumanu kila tale e so, na veika kece era qasi voli, kei na tamata kecega.

source_text: all in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land, died.
target_text: na veika kecega sa tiko kina nai cegu ni bula ena ucudra, na veika kece sa tiko ena vanua mamaca, era sa mate.

source_text: and every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.
target_text: na kalou sa vakarusa na ka bula kecega era sa tiko e delai vuravura: na tamata, na manumanu, na veika sa qasi voli, kei na manumanu vuka ni macawa. era sa vakarusai kece mai vuravura. o noa ga, kei ira kece sa tiko ena loma ni waqa, sai ira ga sa bula tiko.

source_text: and the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.
target_text: sa tiko ga na wai e vuravura me dua na drau limasagavulu na siga.

source_text: and god remembered noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and god made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;
target_text: na kalou sa qai nanumi noa kei na veika bula kecega, na manumanu kecega era sa tiko vata kei noa e waqa. sa vakavuna na kalou me liwa e dua na cagi e vuravura, ka sa lutu sobu nai vakarau ni wai.

source_text: the fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
target_text: nai vurevure mai na vei wai titobu kei na veikatuba lalai mai lomalagi era sa tasogo. sa tu vakadua na uca mai lomalagi.

source_text: and the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
target_text: sa drodro tani tiko ga yani na wai mai vuravura. nai otioti ni ka dua na drau limasagavulu ni siga, sa lailai sara na wai.

source_text: and the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of ararat.
target_text: ena i ka tinikavitu ni siga, ni kavitu ni vula, sa mai kasa toka na waqa ena dela ni ulunivanua mai ararata.

source_text: and the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
target_text: sa lutu sobu tikoga na wai ni waluvu me yacova na i katini ni vula. ena matai ni siga ni katini ni vula, era sa laurai mai na dela ni veiulunivanua.

source_text: and it came to pass at the end of forty days, that noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
target_text: sa qai yaco, ni sa yacova mai na mua ni ka vakasagavulu ni siga, sa dolava o noa na vei katuba lalai ni waqa, ea tara ga o koya.

source_text: and he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
target_text: sa vakatala yani o noa e dua na reveni, ka sa veivukayaki tiko ga, me yacova ni sa mamaca mai na vanua.

source_text: also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
target_text: sa vakatala talega mai vua, e dua na ruve, me raica se sa maca dina na wai mai na delai vuravura.

source_text: but the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.
target_text: na ruve sa sega ni raica e dua na vanua me ro kina, ka sa vuka lesu tale ki waqa vei noa, ni se luvu tiko ga o vuravura. sa dodoka yani o noa na ligana ka taura mai na ruve, sa kauta mai na ruve ki vei koya e waqa.

source_text: and he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
target_text: sa wawa tale me vitu na siga, sa qai vakatala tale yani na ruve mai na waqa.

source_text: and the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf pluckt off: so noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
target_text: sa lesu tale mai vua na ruve ena yakavi, ka sa kauta tiko mai e dua na drau ni olive e se qai beti vou, ena gusuna; oqo sa kila kina o noa ni sa oti na waluvu.

source_text: and he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.
target_text: sa wawa tale me vitu na siga ka vakatala tale yani na ruve, na ruve oqo sa sega tale ni lesu mai vua.

source_text: and it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.
target_text: ena i ka ono na drau ka dua ni yabaki, ena i matai ni siga ni matai ni vula, sa maca vakadua na wai mai na delai vuravura; sa cecega o noa na i ubi ni waqa ka rai yani, sa dina sara, sa mamaca tu o vuravura.

source_text: and in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.
target_text: ena i ka ruasagavulu ka vitu ni siga ni karua ni vula, sa mamaca sara na qele.

source_text: and god spake unto noah, saying,
target_text: na kalou sa vosa vei noa ka vaka,

source_text: go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons' wives with thee.
target_text: "lako tani mai na waqa, o iko, kei iratou na luvemu tagane, o watimu kei iratou na vugomu.

source_text: bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
target_text: "me ra lako tani mai vata kei iko na veika bula kece sa vakalewe, na manumanu vuka, na bulumakau kei na veika kece sa qasi voli e delai vuravura, me ra mai vakalewelevutaki ira e vuravura, me ra mai yaga vakalevu ka tubu talega me levu. "

source_text: and noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him:
target_text: sa curu ki tuba o noa kei iratou na luvena tagane, o watina kei iratou na vugona.

source_text: every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.
target_text: na manumanu kece, na veika kece e qasi voli e delai vuravura, na manumanu vuka, me vaka na nodra dui kawa, era sa lako tani mai na waqa.

source_text: and noah builded an altar unto the lord; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
target_text: sa tara o noa e dua nai cabocabo ni soro vei jiova, ka taura mai na veimanumanu savasava kei na veimanumanu vuka e savasava, ka vakacabora me i soro kama ena i cabocabo ni soro.

source_text: and the lord smelled a sweet savour; and the lord said in his heart, i will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will i again smite any more every thing living, as i have done.
target_text: o jiova, sa boica nai boi kamikamica. sa qai tukuna ga e lomana, "au na sega tale ni rukaka na qele ena vuku ni tamata, e dina mada ga ni sa cala tu na vakanananu ni yalo ni tamata mai na gauna e se cauravou kina. au na sega ni vakarusa tale e dua na ka bula me vaka au sa vakayacora oti.

source_text: while the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
target_text: "baleta ni se tiko ga na vuravura, na kakaburaki kei na tatamusuki, na batabata kei na katakata, na vulai liliwa kei na vulai katakata, na siga kei na bogi ena sega ni oti. "

source_text: and god blessed noah and his sons, and said unto them, be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa vakalouvinakataki noa kei iratou na luvena, ka tukuna vei iratou, "mo dou yagavakalevu ka vuavuai, mo dou vakalevutaki kemudou ka vakatawai vuravura.

source_text: and the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth upon the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.
target_text: "na manumanu kece ni vanua kei na manumanu vuka kece kei na ka kecega sa yavavala e delai vuravura, kei na ika kece ni loma ni wai, era na rerevaki kemudou ka taqayataki kemudou. era sa soli kece ki na ligamudou.

source_text: every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have i given you all things.
target_text: "na veika kecega e bula ka yavavala era na kakana vei kemudou. au sa solia vei kemudou na ka kecega wili kina na veimataqali co.

source_text: but flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
target_text: "mo dou kua ga ni kania vata na lewena kei na bula, oqori na kena dra.

source_text: and surely your blood of your lives will i require; at the hand of every beast will i require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man's brother will i require the life of man.
target_text: "ena vuku ni nomu drabula, au na vakataroga; mai na ligadra na manumanu kila, mai na ligadra talega na tamata. mai na ligadra kecega na veitacini, au na taroga mai kina na bula ni dua na tamata.

source_text: whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of god made he man.
target_text: "o koya sa vakadavea na dra ni tamata, na tamata talega ena vakadavea na nona dra; ena veiucui e vakalou, na kalou sa bulia kina na tamata.

source_text: and you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.
target_text: io, veikemudou, mo dou yaga ga vakalevu ka vuavuai ka tubu me lewe levu; me sega o vuravura ka tubu tikoga kina. "

source_text: and god spake unto noah, and to his sons with him, saying,
target_text: na kalou sa qai vosa vei noa kei iratou na luvena ka vaka:

source_text: and i, behold, i establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
target_text: "ena vukuqu, au sa tauyavutaka oqo na noqu veiyalayalati vata kei iko kei ira na nomu kawa era na muri mai,

source_text: and with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.
target_text: "kei na ka bula kecega sa tiko vata kei iko, na manumanu vuka, na bulumakau, na manumanu kecega ni vanua era sa tiko vata kei iko, o ira kecega sa lako tani mai waqa.

source_text: and i will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.
target_text: "au na vakatauyavutaka na noqu veiyalayalati vata kei iko: ena sega tale, sa na sega ni vakarusai tale o vuravura ena waluvu. "

source_text: and god said, this is the token of the covenant which i make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
target_text: na kalou sa tukuna: "oqo nai vakatakilakila ni veiyalayalati au sa cakava vei kedaru, kei na veika bula kecega sa tiko vata kei iko, ki nai tabatamata e sega ni mudu:

source_text: i do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.
target_text: "au sa na tuvana na noqu drodrolagi ena vei o, mei vakatakilakila ni veiyalayalati mai vei au kei vuravura.

source_text: and it shall come to pass, when i bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:
target_text: "ni sa yaco, me'u kauta mai na vei o e delai vuravura, ka sa raici na drodrolagi ena vei o;

source_text: and i will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
target_text: "au na nanuma na noqu veiyalayalati ena kedaru maliwa kei na veika bula kece sa vakalewe; na wai ena sega tale ni waluvu me vakarusa na veikabula e vuravura.

source_text: and the bow shall be in the cloud; and i will look upon it, that i may remember the everlasting covenant between god and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.
target_text: "na drodrolagi ena tiko ga ena vei o, au na vakaraica yani me'u vakananuma kina na veiyalayalati e sega ni mudu nona na kalou kei na veika bula kecega e vuravura. "

source_text: and god said unto noah, this is the token of the covenant, which i have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
target_text: na kalou sa qai tukuna vei noa, "oqo nai vakatakilakila ni veiyalayalati au sa tauyavutaka vei au kei na ka bula kecega era sa tiko e vuravura. "

source_text: and the sons of noah, that went forth of the ark, were shem, and ham, and japheth: and ham is the father of canaan.
target_text: o iratou na luvei noa sa lako tani mai na waqa, o semi, ame kei jevica. o ame sa tamadra na kai kenani.

source_text: these are the three sons of noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.
target_text: o iratou oqo na luve i noa, sa vakatawani kina o vuravura taucoko.

source_text: and noah began to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
target_text: o noa, sa tekivu me teivaka na vanua, sa vaka veivaini o koya.

source_text: and he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
target_text: sa gunu waini o koya, sa mateni kina ka sa luvawale ni sa davo moce tu ena nona valelaca.

source_text: and ham, the father of canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
target_text: o ame na tamadra na kai kenani, sa raici tamana ni sa luvawale tu, sa qai tukuna veirau na tacina e tautuba.

source_text: and shem and japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness.
target_text: o semi kei jevica, e rau sa taura e dua nai sulu ka biuta e tabadrau, e rau sa lako vakanadaku ka ubia na luvawale nei tamadrau. e rau sa rai tani tuga â€œme rau kua ni raica kina na luvawale nei tamadrau.

source_text: and noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.
target_text: ni sa oti na nona mateni o noa, sa qai kila na veika sa cakava o ame vua.

source_text: and he said, cursed be canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
target_text: sa qai tukuna: "me rukaki o kenani; na nodra dauveiqaravi na dauveiqaravi, oqo o koya vei ira na tacina. "

source_text: and he said, blessed be the lord god of shem; and canaan shall be his servant.
target_text: sa qai tukuna tale, "me kalouvinaka o jiova na kalou i semi, ka me nona dauveiqaravi o kenani.

source_text: god shall enlarge japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of shem; and canaan shall be his servant.
target_text: na kalou talega me vakalevutaki jevica, ka me tiko e vale nei semi, me nona dauveiqaravi o kenani. "

source_text: and noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
target_text: sa bula tale tiko o noa ni sa oti na waluvu me tolu na drau limasagavulu na yabaki.

source_text: and all the days of noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
target_text: na veisiga kece ni bula nei noa sa ciwa na drau limasagavulu na yabaki, ka sa qai mate yani.

source_text: now these are the generations of the sons of noah, shem, ham, and japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
target_text: oqo na veikawa nodratou na luvei noa: o semi, o ame kei jevica. o ira oqo sa sucu ni oti na waluvu.

source_text: the sons of japheth; gomer, and magog, and madai, and javan, and tubal, and meshech, and tiras.
target_text: o ira na luvei jevica tagane oqo: o qoma, mekoki, madai, javana, tubali, mesake, kei tirasa.

source_text: and the sons of gomer; ashkenaz, and riphath, and togarmah.
target_text: o iratou na luvei qoma tagane oqo: o asakenasa, rifaci, kei toqama.

source_text: and the sons of javan; elishah, and tarshish, kittim, and dodanim.
target_text: o iratou na luvei javana tagane oqo: o ilaisa, tasisi, kitimi, kei dodanimi.

source_text: by these were the isles of the gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
target_text: mai vei ira oqo, o ira na tamata ni veibaravi ni kai matanitu tani, era sa wasei tani mai na nodra vanua, o ira vakayadua me vaka na nodra dui vosavosa, me vaka na nodra dui vuvale kei na nodra dui vanua.

source_text: and the sons of ham; cush, and mizraim, and phut, and canaan.
target_text: o ira na luvei ame tagane oqo: o kusi, misirami, puti kei kenani.

source_text: and the sons of cush; seba, and havilah, and sabtah, and raamah, and sabtecha: and the sons of raamah; sheba, and dedan.
target_text: o ira na luvei kusi tagane oqo: o seba, avila, sebata, raema kei sabeteka; kei na luvei raema tagane, o seba kei didani.

source_text: and cush begat nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
target_text: o kusi sa vakasucumi vua, o nimirote; sa tekivu me tamata qaqa mai e vuravura.

source_text: he was a mighty hunter before the lord : wherefore it is said, even as nimrod the mighty hunter before the lord.
target_text: sa tamata qaqa ni vakasasa ena mata i jiova; oqo sa tukuni kina, "me vakataki nimirote ena mata i jiova. "

source_text: and the beginning of his kingdom was babel, and erech, and accad, and calneh, in the land of shinar.
target_text: nai tekitekivu ni nona matanitu sai pepeli, o ereki, o akadi kei kalanei, ena vanua o sina.

source_text: out of that land went forth asshur, and builded nineveh, and the city rehoboth, and calah,
target_text: mai kea, sa lako yani ki asiria ka tarai ninive cake, o reopoci uri, kela,

source_text: and resen between nineveh and calah: the same is a great city.
target_text: kei riseni, ena kedrau maliwa o ninive kei kela (na koro levu).

source_text: and mizraim begat ludim, and anamim, and lehabim, and naphtuhim,
target_text: o misirami sa vakasucumi vua o ladimi, ananimi, o leabimi, o navitaimi,

source_text: and pathrusim, and casluhim, (out of whom came philistim, ) and caphtorim.
target_text: o pacurusimi, kei kasuluimi (era sa basika mai vei koya na filisitia kei na kapatorimi).

source_text: and canaan begat sidon his firstborn, and heth,
target_text: o kenani sa vakasucumi vua o saitoni na nona ulumatua kei eci;

source_text: and the jebusite, and the amorite, and the girgasite,
target_text: na jepusaiti, na amoraiti, kei na kirikisaiti;

source_text: and the hivite, and the arkite, and the sinite,
target_text: na ivaiti, na arakaiti kei na sainaiti;

source_text: and the arvadite, and the zemarite, and the hamathite: and afterward were the families of the canaanites spread abroad.
target_text: na arivadaiti, na semaraiti kei na ametaiti. era sa qai tawase na vuvale nei kenani, ni oti oqo.

source_text: and the border of the canaanites was from sidon, as thou comest to gerar, unto gaza; as thou goest, unto sodom, and gomorrah, and admah, and zeboim, even unto lasha.
target_text: nai yalayala nei kenani, sa tekivu mai saitoni, ni o sa lako yani ki kerari, me yaco sara i qasa, ka lako sara i sotoma, komora, adama kei seboimi me yaco sara ki lasa.

source_text: these are the sons of ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.
target_text: oqo o ira na luve i ame, me vaka na nodra veivuvale, me vaka na nodra i vosavosa ena nodra vanua, ena nodra matanitu.

source_text: unto shem also, the father of all the children of eber, the brother of japheth the elder, even to him were children born.
target_text: era sa vakasucumi talega na gone vei semi, na tamadra na luvei eba, na taci jevica na qase.

source_text: the children of shem; elam, and asshur, and arphaxad, and lud, and aram.
target_text: o ira na luvei semi oqo: o ilama, asuri, afakisati, ladi kei erami.

source_text: and the children of aram; uz, and hul, and gether, and mash.
target_text: o ira na luvei erami oqo: o usi, uli, qesa kei masi.

source_text: and arphaxad begat salah; and salah begat eber.
target_text: o afakisati sa vakasucumi vua o sala kei eba sa vakasucumi vei sala.

source_text: and unto eber were born two sons: the name of one was peleg; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother's name was joktan.
target_text: sa vakasucumi vei eba e rua na luvena tagane na yacana e dua o veleki (ni nona gauna sa tawase kina o vuravura) kei joketani na tacina.

source_text: and joktan begat almodad, and sheleph, and hazarmaveth, and jerah,
target_text: sa vakasucumi vei joketani o alemodidi, selefa, asemaveci, jera,

source_text: and hadoram, and uzal, and diklah,
target_text: adorami, usali, dikala,

source_text: and obal, and abimael, and sheba,
target_text: o obala, abimaele, seba,

source_text: and ophir, and havilah, and jobab: all these were the sons of joktan.
target_text: o ofiri, avila kei jobaba. o ira kece oqo na luvei joketani.

source_text: and their dwelling was from mesha, as thou goest unto sephar a mount of the east.
target_text: na vanua era tiko kina mai mesa, ena vanua vaka ki sefara, na ulunivanua mai na tokalau.

source_text: these are the sons of shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
target_text: o ira oqo na luvei semi, me vaka na nodra dui vuvale, me vaka na nodra dui vosavosa, ena nodra vanua, me vaka na nodra veimatanitu.

source_text: these are the families of the sons of noah, after their generations, in their nations: and by these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
target_text: sai ira oqo na vuvale nei noa, me vaka na nodra dui taba-tamata ena nodra dui yasana, eke era sa dui wasei kina na veimatanitu e vuravura ni oti na waluvu.

source_text: and the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.
target_text: na vuravura taucoko sa dua ga na kena vosa ka sa dua talega na kena i vosavosa.

source_text: and it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of shinar; and they dwelt there.
target_text: sa qai yaco, ni ra sa lako tiko mai na tokalau, era sa kunea sara e dua na buca ena vanua o sina, ka era sa tiko sara kina.

source_text: and they said one to another, go to, let us make brick, and burn them throughly. and they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.
target_text: era sa veivosaki vakai ira ka vaka, "me da sa buli vatutuva mada ka kuvuya vakavinaka. " sa tu vei ira na veika me buli kina na vatutuva oqo.

source_text: and they said, go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
target_text: era sa tukuna sara, "ni lako mai, meda tara mada e dua na noda koro kei na dua na vale vakaitaba, na delana me tiko mai lomalagi; me kilai kina na yacada, de, eda na qai vakasesei yani ena matai vuravura taucoko. "

source_text: and the lord came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
target_text: sa lako sobu mai o jiova me raica na koro kei na vale vakaitaba, o koya era sa tara tiko na tamata.

source_text: and the lord said, behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.
target_text: sa tukuna o jiova, "era sa dua ga na tamata, ka sa dua ga na nodra vosa. raica oqo na veika era sa tekivu mera cakava, sa sega na veika e tiko tale, me na tarova na veika era sa nakita.

source_text: go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.
target_text: "mai, medatou lako sobu ka vakasesea na nodra vosa, me ra kakua ni veikilai vosavosa kina. "

source_text: so the lord scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.
target_text: o jiova sa vakacemuri ira tani mai kea ki na veiyasai vuravura kece, sa mai tu vakadua na tarai cake ni koro.

source_text: therefore is the name of it called babel; because the lord did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the lord scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
target_text: sa vakayacani na koro o ya me pepeli, baleta, ni o jiova sa vakasesea na nodra vosa kecega e vuravura. mai kea talega sa wasewasei ira yani kina ki vuravura taucoko.

source_text: these are the generations of shem: shem was an hundred years old, and begat arphaxad two years after the flood:
target_text: oqo na kawa tamata i semi. o semi sa yabaki dua na drau ni sa vakasucumi vua o afakisati, oqori ni sa oti e rua na yabaki mai na waluvu.

source_text: and shem lived after he begat arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o afakisati, sa bula tale tiko o semi me lima na drau na yabaki, ka sa so tale na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat salah:
target_text: o afakisati sa yabaki tolusagavulu ka lima ni sa sucu o sala.

source_text: and arphaxad lived after he begat salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: sa sucu oti o sala, sa bula tale tiko o afakisati me yabaki va na drau ka tolu, ka sa so tale na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and salah lived thirty years, and begat eber:
target_text: sa yabaki tolusagavulu o sala ni sa sucu o eba.

source_text: and salah lived after he begat eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: sa bula tiko o eba me va na drau ka tolu tale na yabaki ka sa so tale na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and eber lived four and thirty years, and begat peleg:
target_text: sa yabaki tolusagavulu ka va o eba ni sa sucu o veleki.

source_text: and eber lived after he begat peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o veleki, sa bula tale tiko o eba me va na drau tolusagavulu na yabaki ka sa so talega na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and peleg lived thirty years, and begat reu:
target_text: sa yabaki tolusagavulu o veleki ni sa sucu o reu.

source_text: and peleg lived after he begat reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o reu, sa bula tale tiko o veleki me rua na drau ka ciwa na yabaki ka sa sucu tale eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and reu lived two and thirty years, and begat serug:
target_text: o reu sa yabaki tolusagavulu ni sa sucu o seruki.

source_text: and reu lived after he begat serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o seruki, sa bula tale tiko o reu me rua na drau ka vitu na yabaki ka sa sucu tale eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and serug lived thirty years, and begat nahor:
target_text: sa yabaki tolusagavulu o seruki ni sa sucu o neori.

source_text: and serug lived after he begat nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o neori, sa bula tale tiko o seruki me rua na drau na yabaki, era sa sucu talega eso na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat terah:
target_text: sa yabaki ruasagavulu ka ciwa o neori, ni sa sucu o tera.

source_text: and nahor lived after he begat terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
target_text: ni sa sucu oti o tera, sa bula tale tiko o neori me dua na drau tinikaciwai ka sa so tale na luvena tagane kei na luvena yalewa.

source_text: and terah lived seventy years, and begat abram, nahor, and haran.
target_text: sa yabaki vitusagavulu o tera ni ratou sa sucu o eparama, neori kei arana.

source_text: now these are the generations of terah: terah begat abram, nahor, and haran; and haran begat lot.
target_text: oqo na kawa nei tera: sa vakasucumi vei tera o eparama, neori kei arana. mai vei arana sa kune kina o loti.

source_text: and haran died before his father terah in the land of his nativity, in ur of the chaldees.
target_text: sa mate o arana ena mata i tamana o tera, ena nona vanua mai uri e kalitia.

source_text: and abram and nahor took them wives: the name of abram's wife was sarai; and the name of nahor's wife, milcah, the daughter of haran, the father of milcah, and the father of iscah.
target_text: e rau sa vakawati o eparama kei neori, na yaca ni wati eparama o serai kei na wati neori o milika, na luvei arana yalewa, na tamai milika, kei isika.

source_text: but sarai was barren; she had no child.
target_text: sa yava o serai ka sega na luvena.
