target_text: o eparaama sa vakayacana na vanua o ya me, sa vakarautaka o jiova, me yacova na siga oqo. "ena ulunivanua i jiova, sa vakarautaki kina. "

source_text: and the angel of the lord called unto abraham out of heaven the second time,
target_text: na agilosi i jiova sa kacivi eparaama vakarua mai lomalagi,

source_text: and said, by myself have i sworn, saith the lord, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son:
target_text: ka vaka: "vei au ga vakai au, au sa bubului kina, sa tukuna vaka oqo o jiova, ni o sa cakava na ka oqo, ka sa sega ni bureitaka na luvemu tagane e dua gaâ€

source_text: that in blessing i will bless thee, and in multiplying i will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;
target_text: "ena veivakalouvinakataki, au na vakalouvinakataki iko, ena veivakatuburi, au na vakatuburi iko vakalevu sara, me vaka na veikalokalo ni lomalagi, me vaka talega na nuku ni veimatasawa. o ira na nomu kawa era na taukena na nodra matamata na nodra meca.

source_text: and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
target_text: "mai vei iko, na matanitu kece e vuravura era na vakalouvinakataki, baleta ni o sa rogoca na domoqu. "

source_text: so abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to beersheba; and abraham dwelt at beersheba.
target_text: sa lesu tale o eparaama vei rau na nona cauravou, e rau sa tucake, ka ratou sa lesu vata ki periesepa; ka sa tiko mai periesepa o eparaama.

source_text: and it came to pass after these things, that it was told abraham, saying, behold, milcah, she hath also born children unto thy brother nahor;
target_text: sa oti na veika oqo, sa tukuni vei eparaama ka vaka, "o milika talega sa vakasucu gone vei neori na tacimu:

source_text: huz his firstborn, and buz his brother, and kemuel the father of aram,
target_text: "o usi na ulumatua, o buse na tacina, o kemueli na tamai erami,

source_text: and chesed, and hazo, and pildash, and jidlaph, and bethuel.
target_text: "o keseti, o aso, o pilidosi, o jidafa kei pecueli. "

source_text: and bethuel begat rebekah: these eight milcah did bear to nahor, abraham's brother.
target_text: o pecueli sa vakasucumi vua o repeka. o ira na lewe walu oqo sa vakasucuma o milika vei neori na taci eparaama.

source_text: and his concubine, whose name was reumah, she bare also tebah, and gaham, and thahash, and maachah.
target_text: na watina lailai o reuma, sa vakasucumi teba, qaema, taesi kei maeka.

source_text: and sarah was an hundred and seven and twenty years old: these were the years of the life of sarah.
target_text: sa bula tiko o sera me dua na drau ruasagavulu ka vitu na yabaki; oqo na veiyabaki ni bula nei sera.

source_text: and sarah died in kirjatharba; the same is hebronin the land of canaan: and abraham came to mourn for sarah, and to weep for her.
target_text: sa mate o sera mai kirijaci araba (oqori o epironi) ena vanua o kenani. sa lako mai o eparaama me lolokutaki sera ka tagicaki koya.

source_text: and abraham stood up from before his dead, and spake unto the sons of heth, saying,
target_text: sa tucake o eparaama mai na nona mate; ka vosa ki vei ira na luvei eci ka vaka,

source_text: i am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that i may bury my dead out of my sight.
target_text: "o au e dua na vulagi, ka dau veitosoyaki tu ga ena kemuni maliwa. mo ni solia vei au e dua na tikina me noqu i bulubulu ena kemuni maliwa, me'u buluta tani kina na noqu mate mai mataqu. "

source_text: and the children of heth answered abraham, saying unto him,
target_text: era sa sauma vei eparaama na luvei eci tagane ka vaka,

source_text: hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.
target_text: "mo rogoci keimami, na neimami turaga, o sa tamata qaqa ena keimami maliwa, buluta na nomu mate ena vanua ga o sa digitaka. ena sega ni dua vei keimami ena bureitaka na nona i bulubulu, mo buluta kina na nomu mate. "

source_text: and abraham stood up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of heth.
target_text: sa tucake o eparaama ka cuva ni vakarokoroko vei ira na tamata ni vanua, na luvei eci.

source_text: and he communed with them, saying, if it be your mind that i should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intreat for me to ephron the son of zohar,
target_text: sa vosa talega vei ira ka vaka: "kevaka sa nomuni gagadre me'u buluta tani na noqu mate mai mataqu â€œmo ni rogoci au, mo ni sota mada kei efironi na luvei soa ena vukuqu,

source_text: that he may give me the cave of machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you.
target_text: "me solia mada vei au na veiqara vatu e makapila, o koya sa tiko vua, sa tiko ena mua ni were oqo. me solia vei au ena kena i sau taucoko. me taukeni kina nai bulubulu oqo ena kemuni maliwa. "

source_text: and ephron dwelt among the children of heth: and ephron the hittite answered abraham in the audience of the children of heth, even of all that went in at the gate of his city, saying,
target_text: o efironi sa tiko ena kedra maliwa na luvei eci; sa sauma o efironi na itaiti vei eparaama ena matadra na luvei eci, o ira kece sa curu mai e nona matamata ka vaka,

source_text: nay, my lord, hear me: the field give i thee, and the cave that is therein, i give it thee; in the presence of the sons of my people give i it thee: bury thy dead.
target_text: "e sega noqu turaga, au sa solia vei iko na veiwere kei na qara vatu sa tiko kina. au sa solia vei iko ena matadra kece na noqu tamata, au sa solia vei iko â€œbuluta kina na nomu mate! "

source_text: and abraham bowed down himself before the people of the land.
target_text: sa cuva sobu o eparaama ena matadra na tamata ni vanua;

source_text: and he spake unto ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, but if thou wilt give it, i pray thee, hear me: i will give thee money for the field; take it of me, and i will bury my dead there.
target_text: sa qai vosa vei efironi ena matadra kece na tamata ka vaka: "kevaka o sa solia vei au, mo rogoca talega oqo, au na solia vei iko nai lavo ena vuku ni vanua, taura oqo mai vei au â€œau na qai buluta na noqu mate e kea. "

source_text: and ephron answered abraham, saying unto him,
target_text: sa sauma o efironi vei eparama ka vaka,

source_text: my lord, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver; what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
target_text: "mo rogoci au na noqu turaga, na vanua sa kenai sau e rua na drau onosagavulu na dola, na cava oqori ena kedaru maliwa? buluta ga yani na nomu mate. "

source_text: and abraham hearkened unto ephron; and abraham weighed to ephron the silver, which he had named in the audience of the sons of heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
target_text: sa rogoca o eparaama na vosa nei efironi, ka sa vakarautaka na i lavo me vaka sa tukuni ena nodra vakarorogo na luvei eci, e rua na drau onosagavulu na dola, ena i lavo ni veivoli.

source_text: and the field of ephron, which was in machpelah, which was before mamre, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the borders round about, were made sure
target_text: na vanua nei efironi ena vanua e makapila sa tiko ena matai mamire, na vanua kei na qara vatu sa tiko kina, kei na vunikau kece sa tiko kina kei na veika kece sa tiko vakavolivolita, sa tiko ena veivolivoli oqo

source_text: unto abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of heth, before all that went in at the gate of his city.
target_text: vei eparaama me sa kena i taukei ena matadra kece na luvei eci, o ira kece sa lako mai ena matamata ni koro.

source_text: and after this, abraham buried sarah his wife in the cave of the field of machpelah before mamre: the same is hebronin the land of canaan.
target_text: ni sa oti oqo, sa buluti sera o eparaama ena qaravatu ni vanua e makapila e mamire (oqori o epironi) ena vanua e kenani.

source_text: and the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto abraham for a possession of a buryingplace by the sons of heth.
target_text: na vanua kei na qaravatu sa tiko kina, sa volitaki vei eparaama mai vei ira na luvei eci, me nona i bulubulu.

source_text: and abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and the lord had blessed abraham in all things.
target_text: sa qase mai o eparaama ka sa levu sara na nona veiyabaki. o jiova talega sa vakalouvinakataki eparaama ena ka kecega.

source_text: and abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, put, i pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
target_text: sa tukuna o eparaama vua na nona dauveiqaravi qase duadua â€œo koya sa lewa na nona veika kecega, "daramaka mada mai na ligamu ena ruku ni sagaqu,

source_text: and i will make thee swear by the lord, the god of heaven, and the god of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the canaanites, among whom i dwell:
target_text: "me'u cakava vei iko, mo bubului vei jiova, na kalou ni lomalagi kei na kalou ni vuravura, o ya, mo kua ni taura mai e dua na yalewa ni vanua oqo o kenani, me watina na luvequ;

source_text: but thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son isaac.
target_text: "mo lako ga ki noqu vanua, vei ira na wekaqu ka kauta mai e dua me watina na luvequ o aisake. "

source_text: and the servant said unto him, peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must i needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?
target_text: sa tukuna vua na nona dauveiqaravi, "de qai sega ni vinakata, na yalewa me lako mai ki na vanua oqo. me'u kauta lesu beka na luvemu ki na vanua o lako mai kina? "

source_text: and abraham said unto him, beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again.
target_text: sa tukuna vua o eparaama, "mo qarauna mo kua ni kauta na luvequ ki kea.

source_text: the lord god of heaven, which took me from my father's house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying, unto thy seed will i give this land; he shall send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence.
target_text: "na kalou o jiova, o koya sa kauti au tani mai na vale i tamaqu kei na nodra vanua na wekaqu, o koya sa vosa vei au ka yalataka vei au ka vaka: 'ki vei ira na nomu kawa au na solia kina na vanua oqo. ' ena tala liu na nona agilosi vei iko, o na kauta mai e dua na watina na luvequ mai kea.

source_text: and if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.
target_text: "kevaka sa sega ni via lako mai na yalewa vata kei kemuni, o sa na vakagalalataki mai na bubului oqo; mo kua ga ni kauta na luvequ tagane ki kea. "

source_text: and the servant put his hand under the thigh of abraham his master, and sware to him concerning that matter.
target_text: na dauveiqaravi sa daramaka na ligana ena ruku ni sagai eparaama na nona turaga, ka bubului ena vuku ni veika sa vakamacalataki.

source_text: and the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to mesopotamia, unto the city of nahor.
target_text: na dauveiqaravi sa kauta e tini na kameli ni nona turaga ka lako yani â€œni sa tiko e ligana na veika kece ena vuku ni nona turaga. sa lako yani ki mesapotomia na koro nei neori.

source_text: and he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw water.
target_text: era sa tekiduru sobu na nona kameli ena taudaku ni koro ena bat ni wai, ni sa yakavi mai â€œoqo na gauna era sa dau mai taki wai kina na yalewa.

source_text: and he said, o lord god of my master abraham, i pray thee, send me good speed this day, and shew kindness unto my master abraham.
target_text: sa tukuna na dauveiqaravi, "i jiova na kalou nei eparaama na noqu turaga, mo ni solia vei au na qaqa e na siga oqo, ka mo ni vakaraitaka na vinaka vua na noqu turaga o eparaama.

source_text: behold, i stand here by the well of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water:
target_text: "mo ni raica, au sa tu oqo ena mata ni wai â€œera sa lako tiko mai oqo na yalewa mai na koro me taki wai.

source_text: and let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom i shall say, let down thy pitcher, i pray thee, that i may drink; and she shall say, drink, and i will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant isaac; and thereby shall i know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master.
target_text: "me yaco, vei koya na gone yalewa au sa tukuna vua, 'mo biuta sobu mada na nomu saqa me'u gunu mada, ' ka me tukuna mai oqo, 'gunu, au na vakagunuva talega na nomu kameli, 'me sai koya oqo o ni sa digitaka vua na nomuni tamata o aisake. ena ka oqo au na kila kina ni o ni sa vakaraitaka na loloma vua na noqu turaga. "

source_text: and it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, rebekah came out, who was born to bethuel, son of milcah, the wife of nahor, abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
target_text: sa yaco ni se bera ni oti na nona vosa, o rapeka na luvei petueli na luvei milika, na wati neori na taci eparaama, sa lako vata tiko mai kei na nona saqa ena vatuvatu ni tabana.

source_text: and the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
target_text: na goneyalewa oqo (rapeka), sa ka ga me vakasaravi, baleta ni sa rui goneyalewa totoka ka sega ni kila na tagane. sa lako sobu ki na wai ka vakatawana na nona saqa, ka lako cake mai.

source_text: and the servant ran to meet her, and said, let me, i pray thee, drink a little water of thy pitcher.
target_text: sa cici yani na dauveiqaravi me sotavi koya ka tukuna, "au kerea me'u gunu mada ga mai na nomu saqa wai. "

source_text: and she said, drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
target_text: sa tukuna mai na goneyalewa, "mo gunu na noqu turaga" â€œsa biuta mai vakatotolo na nona saqa ka solia yani vua me gunu.

source_text: and when she had done giving him drink, she said, i will draw water for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.
target_text: ni sa solia oti me gunu, sa tukuna tale, "au na la'ki taki wai talega me medra na kameli, me yacova ni ra sa gunu kece. "

source_text: and she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.
target_text: sa vakatotolo yani me taki wai tikotiko ga me yacova ni ra sa gunu kece na kameli.

source_text: and the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the lord had made his journey prosperous or not.
target_text: sa vakaraici koya tikoga na dauveiqaravi, sa galu tiko ni via kila se sa lewa i jiova oqo, se sega.

source_text: and it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;
target_text: ena gauna era sa gunu oti kina na kameli, na dauveiqaravi, sa taura mai e dua na mama ni ucu koula, ka dua nai kava na onisi na kena bibi kei na rua na qato ni liga koula, e lima na onisi na kena bibi, ka daramaka vua na yalewa,

source_text: and said, whose daughter art thou? tell me, i pray thee: is there room in thy father's house for us to lodge in?
target_text: ka taroga na goneyalewa, "o luvei cei o iko? tukuna vei au, e tiko beka e so nai cili ena nomudou vale me keitou vakacegu kina? "

source_text: and she said unto him, i am the daughter of bethuel the son of milcah, which she bare unto nahor.
target_text: sa sauma mai na goneyalewa, "oi au na luvei petueli, na luvei milika, na wati neori. "

source_text: she said moreover unto him, we have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
target_text: sa tukuna tale vua, "sa tu vei keitou na ka e veiraurau vei kemudou kei ira na manumanu, kei na i cili mo dou vakacegu kina. "

source_text: and the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the lord.
target_text: sa cuva sobu na dauveiqaravi i eparaama ka lotu vei jiova.

source_text: and he said, blessed be the lord god of my master abraham, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: i being in the way, the lord led me to the house of my master's brethren.
target_text: sa tukuna, "me vakalouvinakataki na kalou o jiova nei eparaama, o koya sa sega ni vakawaletaka na nona loloma kei na nona dina vua na noqu turaga. ni sa tuberi au mai o jiova ki na vale nei koya na taci noqu turaga. "

source_text: and the damsel ran, and told them of her mother's house these things.
target_text: sa cici yani na goneyalewa ka tukuna vei ira na vale nei tinana na veika oqo.

source_text: and rebekah had a brother, and his name was laban: and laban ran out unto the man, unto the well.
target_text: o rapeka sa dua na ganena, na yacana o lepani, sa cici yani o lepani ki vua na tamata mai na mata ni wai.

source_text: and it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of rebekah his sister, saying, thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.
target_text: sa yaco ni sa raica na mama ni ucu kei na qato e ligana na ganena, ka sa rogoci rapeka talega ni sa tukuna, "sa vosa vei au na tamata o ya, " sa qai lako yani vua na dauveiqaravi i eparaama ni sa tucake tu mai na mataniwai vata kei ira na kameli.

source_text: and he said, come in, thou blessed of the lord; wherefore standest thou without? for i have prepared the house, and room for the camels.
target_text: sa tukuna yani, "dou lako mai na veivakalouvinakataki i jiova! na cava dou sa tu ga kina e tuba? au sa vakarautaka oti na vale kei na vanua me ra cegu kina na kameli. "

source_text: and the man came into the house: and he ungirded his camels, and gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him.
target_text: sa curu yani na tamata (dauveiqaravi) ki vale, sa sereka nai colacola ni kameli ka solia na kedra kakana. sa savata na yavana kei na yavadra na nona i tokani era sa lako vata mai.

source_text: and there was set meat before him to eat: but he said, i will not eat, until i have told mine errand. and he said, speak on.
target_text: sa biu mai matana na kakana me kana, ia, sa vosa mada e liu ka vaka: "au na sega mada ni kana, me'u tukuna mada e liu na ka au mai cakava. " sa sauma mai o lepani, "mo vosa sara. "

source_text: and he said, i am abraham's servant.
target_text: sa tukuna mai, "oi au na tamata dauveiqaravi nei eparaama.

source_text: and the lord hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and menservants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.
target_text: "o jiova sa vakalouvinakataki koya vakalevu sara, ka sa tamata qaqa sara; na kalou sa solia vua na manumanu, na siliva, na koula, na tagane kei na yalewa dauveiqaravi, na kameli kei na asa e levu sara.

source_text: and sarah my master's wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
target_text: "o sera na watina na noqu turaga, sa vakasucuma e dua na gone tagane vua na noqu turaga ni sa qase sara; sa solia vua na luvena tagane oqo na veika kecega; o koya na noqu turaga.

source_text: and my master made me swear, saying, thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the canaanites, in whose land i dwell:
target_text: "sa cakava na noqu turaga me'u bubului, ka vaka: 'mo kua ni kauta vua na luvequ tagane me watina e dua na yalewa ni vanua oqo, o kenani;

source_text: but thou shalt go unto my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.
target_text: 'mo lako ga ki na vale nei tamaqu, vei ira na wekaqu, ka kauta mai e dua na yalewa me watina. '

source_text: and i said unto my master, peradventure the woman will not follow me.
target_text: "au sa taroga na noqu turaga, 'de qai sega ni via muri au mai na yalewa. '

source_text: and he said unto me, the lord, before whom i walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house:
target_text: "sa sauma mai vei au o jiova, 'o koya au sa lako voli e matana ena tala mai na nona agilosi vei iko, ena vakataucokotaka na nomu i lakolako, ka o na kauta mai e dua na watina na luvequ mai vei ira na wekaqu â€œmai na vale i tamaqu.

source_text: then shalt thou be clear from this my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
target_text: 'o na vakagalalataki mai na bubului oqo, kevaka o sa yaco yani vei ira na wekaqu, qai o sega ni kauta mai e dua na yalewa. o sa na galala mai na bubului oqo. '

source_text: and i came this day unto the well, and said, o lord god of my master abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which i go:
target_text: "ena siga oqo, ni'u sa lako mai ki na mata ni wai ka masu, 'i jiova na kalou ni noqu turaga o eparaama, kevaka e dina ni o ni na vakataucokotaka nai lakolako oqo,

source_text: behold, i stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and i say to her, give me, i pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink;
target_text: 'raica, au na tu ena mata ni wai, na goneyalewa ga ena lako mai me takiwai, ka au na tukuna vua â€œ"mo solia mai na wai me'u gunu. "

source_text: and she say to me, both drink thou, and i will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom the lord hath appointed out for my master's son.
target_text: 'ka me na sauma sara mai, "oqo mo gunu, au na vakagunuvi ira talega na nomu kameli, " me sai koya oqo na yalewa sa digitaka o jiova me watina na luve ni noqu turaga. '

source_text: and before i had done speaking in mine heart, behold, rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew water: and i said unto her, let me drink, i pray thee.
target_text: "ni se bera ni'u masu oti, sa lako mai o rapeka vata kei na nona saqa wai e domona â€œsa lako sobu sara ki na mata ni wai ka taki. 'au sa kerekere sara me'u gunu. '

source_text: and she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, drink, and i will give thy camels drink also: so i drank, and she made the camels drink also.
target_text: "sa vakatotolo sara o koya me biuta e ra na nona saqa wai ka solia mai. me'u 'gunu â€œsa tukuna talega me vakagunuvi ira na kameli. '

source_text: and i asked her, and said, whose daughter art thou? and she said, the daughter of bethuel, nahor's son, whom milcah bare unto him: and i put the earring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.
target_text: "au sa mani tarogi koya, 'o iko na luvei cei? ' sa sauma mai, 'oi au na luvei petueli na luvei neori, sa vakasucuma vua o milika. ' au sa vakadaramaka sara vua na mama ni ucu kei na qato ni liga, e ligana.

source_text: and i bowed down my head, and worshipped the lord, and blessed the lord god of my master abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter unto his son.
target_text: "au sa cuva sobu ki na qele ka lotu vei jiova, ka vakalouvinakataka na kalou o jiova, na kalou ni noqu turaga o eparaama, o koya sa tuberi au mai ena sala dina me'u mai kauta na goneyalewa na luvena na tacina na noqu turaga me rau la'ki veiwatini kei na luvena tagane.

source_text: and now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that i may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
target_text: "oqo, kevaka dou sa cakacaka vakadodonu vua na noqu turaga, mo dou tukuna vei au, se, me'u gole ki nai matau se ki nai mawi. "

source_text: then laban and bethuel answered and said, the thing proceedeth from the lord: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
target_text: o lepani kei petueli, e rau sa sauma mai ka vaka: "na veika sa lako mai vei jiova keirau sa sega ni rawa ni tukuna ni vinaka se ca.

source_text: behold, rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's son's wife, as the lord hath spoken.
target_text: "sa tu ga oqo o rapeka, tauri koya ka drau lako yani me la'ki watina na luvena tagane na nomu turaga, me vaka sa tukuna o jiova. "

source_text: and it came to pass, that, when abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the lord, bowing himself to the earth.
target_text: ni sa rogoca oqo na dauveiqaravi i eparaama, sa lotu vei jiova ka vakacuva na uluna ki na qele.

source_text: and the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
target_text: na dauveiqaravi sa kauta mai na i yau talei siliva, nai yau talei koula, na i sulu, ka solia vei rapeka. sa solia talega na yau talei sara vei ganena kei tinana.

source_text: and they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, send me away unto my master.
target_text: na dauveiqaravi kei ira na tamata era sa kana ka gunu ka vakacegu ena bogi. era sa yadra ena mataka ka tukuna, "laivi au mada me'u lako vua na noqu turaga. "

source_text: and her brother and her mother said, let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
target_text: ia, o ganei rapeka kei tinana e rau sa tukuna, "me tiko mada vata kei keitou na goneyalewa me tini tale na siga, ka me qai lako yani. "

source_text: and he said unto them, hinder me not, seeing the lord hath prospered my way; send me away that i may go to my master.
target_text: sa sauma yani na dauveiqaravi, "dou kua ni vakataotaki au, o jiova sa dolava oti na noqui lakolako; dou laivi au me'u lako â€œme'u lako yani vua na noqu turaga. "

source_text: and they said, we will call the damsel, and enquire at her mouth.
target_text: e ratou sa tukuna tale, "me keitou taroga mada na goneyalewa. "

source_text: and they called rebekah, and said unto her, wilt thou go with this man? and she said, i will go.
target_text: e ratou sa kacivi rapeka mai ka taroga, "o na lako beka vata kei na dauveiqaravi oqo? " sa sauma mai o rapeka, "au na lako. "

source_text: and they sent away rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and abraham's servant, and his men.
target_text: era sa vakatalai rapeka yani kei na nona nasi kei na dauveiqaravi nei eparaama kei ira na tamata.

source_text: and they blessed rebekah, and said unto her, thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them.
target_text: era sa vosa vakalouvinakataki rapeka ka tukuna vua: "mo yaco mo tinadra na vei udolu kei na vei tini na udolu; kei na nomu kawa mera taukena na nodra veimatamata o ira sa cati kemuni. "

source_text: and rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took rebekah, and went his way.
target_text: o rapeka kei ira na nona dauveiqaravi, era sa vodoka na kameli ka muri ira yani na tamata. era sa kauti rapeka yani, ka lako sara.

source_text: and isaac came from the way of the well lahairoi; for he dwelt in the south country.
target_text: o aisake sa lako mai vaka ki bea-laei-roi, ni sa tiko mai na ceva.

source_text: and isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camels were coming.
target_text: sa lako yani o aisake ki na veibuca me vakanananu mada ni sa yakavi mai. sa rai sara yani, ka raica na veikameli era sa lako tiko mai.

source_text: and rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw isaac, she lighted off the camel.
target_text: sa rai yani o rapeka, ka sa raici aisake sara. sa sobu mai ena nona kameli;

source_text: for she had said unto the servant, what man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? and the servant had said, it is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.
target_text: ni sa taroga oti na dauveiqaravi â€œse ocei na tagane sa lako tiko mai oqo me sotavi ira? sa tukuna yani vua, "ni oqo na luve ni noqu turaga. " sa taura o rapeka na nona i ubi ka ubi koya ga vakavinaka.

source_text: and the servant told isaac all things that he had done.
target_text: na dauveiqaravi sa tukuna vei aisake na veika kece sa cakava oti.

source_text: and isaac brought her into his mother sarah's tent, and took rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
target_text: o aisake sa kauta mai na goneyalewa ki na valelaca nei sera na tinana; sa tauri rapeka, ka sa yaco me watina ka sa lomani rapeka dina sara. oqo sa vakacegui vinaka kina o aisake mai na mate nei tinana.

source_text: then again abraham took a wife, and her name was keturah.
target_text: sa vakawati tale o eparaama, na yaca i watina o ketura.

source_text: and she bare him zimran, and jokshan, and medan, and midian, and ishbak, and shuah.
target_text: sa sucu kina o simirani, jokesani, medani, mitiani, isibaki kei sua.

source_text: and jokshan begat sheba, and dedan. and the sons of dedan were asshurim, and letushim, and leummim.
target_text: o jokesani sa vakasucumi vua o seba kei didani. na luvei didani o asurimi, letusimi, kei liumimi.

source_text: and the sons of midian; ephah, and epher, and hanoch, and abidah, and eldaah. all these were the children of keturah.
target_text: na luvei mitiani o efa, eferi, anoti, ebida, kei eledae. o ira kece oqo na gone mai vei ketura.

source_text: and abraham gave all that he had unto isaac.
target_text: o eparaama sa solia na veika kece sa nona vei aisake.

source_text: but unto the sons of the concubines, which abraham had, abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
target_text: o eparama sa solia talega na veika vei ira na luvena ni watina talai. ni se bula tikoga o eparaama, sa vakatalai ira tani yani oqo, mai vei aisake ki na tokalau.

source_text: and these are the days of the years of abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
target_text: na veiyabaki sa bula kina o eparaama sa dua nadrau vitusagavulu ka lima na yabaki.

source_text: then abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
target_text: sa ceguva nai otioti ni nona i cegu o eparaama ka sa mate yani ni sa qase sara. sa lako yani vei ira na kai nona.

source_text: and his sons isaac and ishmael buried him in the cave of machpelah, in the field of ephron the son of zohar the hittite, which is before mamre;
target_text: e rau sa buluti koya na luvena o aisake kei isimeli ena qaravatu mai makapila, e mamire, ena veiwere nei efironi na luvei soa na itaiti;

source_text: the field which abraham purchased of the sons of heth: there was abraham buried, and sarah his wife.
target_text: na vanua sa volia o eparaama mai vei ira na luvei eci. e rau sa bulu mai kea o eparaama kei sera na watina.

source_text: and it came to pass after the death of abraham, that god blessed his son isaac; and isaac dwelt by the well lahairoi.
target_text: sa yaco ni sa mate oti o eparaama, na kalou sa vosa vakalouvinakataki aisake na luvena. o aisake sa tiko mai bea-laei-roi.

source_text: now these are the generations of ishmael, abraham's son, whom hagar the egyptian, sarah's handmaid, bare unto abraham:
target_text: oqo na kawa nei isimeli na luvei eparama vei eka na yalewa dauveiqaravi ni ijipita nei sera.

source_text: and these are the names of the sons of ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of ishmael, nebajoth; and kedar, and adbeel, and mibsam,
target_text: oqo na yacadra na luvei isimeli â€œna dui yacadra kei na nodra dui kawa: na ulumatua nei isimeli o nebajoci; sa qai kedari, adibili, mibisami,

source_text: and mishma, and dumah, and massa,
target_text: misama, duma, masa,

source_text: hadar, and tema, jetur, naphish, and kedemah:
target_text: adari, tema, jeturi, nafisi kei kedema.

source_text: these are the sons of ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.
target_text: sai ira oqori na luvei isimeli, oqo talega na yaca ni nodra vei koro kei nai tikotiko vagalala, e tinikarua na ravouvou me vaka na nodra dui vanua.

source_text: and these are the years of the life of ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died; and was gathered unto his people.
target_text: oqo na veiyabaki nei isimeli, e dua na drau tolusagavulu ka vitu na yabaki; sa ceguva nai otioti ni nona i cegu ka mate yani, sa soqoni yani vei ira na nona tamata.

source_text: and they dwelt from havilah unto shur, that is before egypt, as thou goest toward assyria: and he died in the presence of all his brethren.
target_text: (era sa tiko mai avila me yaco sara ki suri, oqori ena tokalau kei ijipita ni o lako yani vaka ki asiria. ) sa mate ena matadra na tacina.

source_text: and these are the generations of isaac, abraham's son: abraham begat isaac:
target_text: oqo na kawa nei aisake, na luvei eparaama. o eparaama sa vakasucumi vua o aisake.

source_text: and isaac was forty years old when he took rebekah to wife, the daughter of bethuel the syrian of padanaram, the sister to laban the syrian.
target_text: o aisake sa yabaki vasagavulu ni rau sa veiwatini kei rapeka na luvei petueli na kai siria mai padani-arami, na ganei lepani na kai siria.

source_text: and isaac intreated the lord for his wife, because she was barren: and the lord was intreated of him, and rebekah his wife conceived.
target_text: o aisake sa vakamamasu vei jiova ena vuku i rapeka na watina, ni sa yava (sega ni vakaluveni), o jiova sa sauma na masu nei aisake, ka sa kunekune sara o rapeka.

source_text: and the children struggled together within her; and she said, if it be so, why am i thus? and she went to enquire of the lord.
target_text: e rau sa yavavala vakalevu na gone e ketei tinadrau, ka sa tukuna kina â€œ"kevaka sa vinaka oqo, na cava sa yaco tiko kina na yavavala e ketequ? " sa lako yani me vakatarogi jiova.

source_text: and the lord said unto her, two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
target_text: sa tukuna vua o jiova, "e rua na matanitu sa tiko oqori e ketemu, e rua na tamata e rau na tawase mai yagomu; e dua ena kaukauwa mai vua tale e dua â€œo koya na qase ena qaravi koya e gone. "

source_text: and when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
target_text: ni sa yaco mai na nona siga ni vakasucu, sa tiko ena kato e dua na drua.

source_text: and the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name esau.
target_text: o koya e liu mai e damusa, sa vaka e dua nai sulu vutivutia na yagona kece: sa vakayacani me o iso.

source_text: and after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on esau's heel; and his name was called jacob: and isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.
target_text: sa qai muri mai o tacina, na ligana sa vesuka tiko mai na bukubuku ni yavai iso. sa vakayacani me o jekope. sa yabaki onosagavulu o aisake ni rau sa sucu mai na luvena drua oqo.

source_text: and the boys grew: and esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.
target_text: e rau sa tubu cake na gone. sa dau vakasasa manumanu o iso ka tamata ni veiwere. o jekope sa tamata malumu tuga ka dau tiko ga e vale.

source_text: and isaac loved esau, because he did eat of his venison: but rebekah loved jacob.
target_text: o aisake sa dau lomani iso, baleta ni sa dau kania na nona manumanu ni vakasasa. ia, o rapeka sa lomani jekope vakalevu. sa volitaka o iso na nona i tutu vakaulumatua

source_text: and jacob sod pottage: and esau came from the field, and he was faint:
target_text: o jekope sa vakasaqa kakana vakarakara tiko ena nona lesu mai na veiwere o iso, ka sa wawale sara vakalevu.

source_text: and esau said to jacob, feed me, i pray thee, with that same red pottage; for i am faint: therefore was his name called edom.
target_text: sa kerea yani o iso vei jekope me kania mada na kakana vakarakara damudamu sa vakarautaka tiko, ni sa rui wawale vakalevu. sa vakayacani sara kina me o itomi.

source_text: and jacob said, sell me this day thy birthright.
target_text: sa tukuna yani o jekope, "mo volitaka na dodonu ni nomu ulumatua vei au ena siga oqo. "

source_text: and esau said, behold, i am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
target_text: sa tukuna mai o iso, "raica au sa voleka ni mate, na cava na kena yaga vei au na ulumatua oqo? "

source_text: and jacob said, swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto jacob.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o jekope, "mo bubului vei au e dai. " sa bubului o iso ena siga o ya vei jekope ka volitaka na nona dodonu vakaulumatua vei jekope.

source_text: then jacob gave esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus esau despised his birthright.
target_text: o jekope sa vakarautaka sara na kakana vakarakara damudamu kei na madrai vei iso. sa kana ka gunu o iso ka tucake ka sa lako yani. o iso sa vakawaletaka na dodonu ni nona ulumatua.

source_text: and there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of abraham. and isaac went unto abimelech king of the philistines unto gerar.
target_text: sa yaco e dua na dausiga levu ena vanua, me vaka na dausiga ena gauna nei eparaama. o aisake sa lako vei apimeleki na tui filisitia e qarari.

source_text: and the lord appeared unto him, and said, go not down into egypt; dwell in the land which i shall tell thee of:
target_text: sa basika vei koya o jiova ka tukuna: "kua ni lako sobu ki ijipita; mo tiko ga ena vanua au na tukuna vei iko.

source_text: sojourn in this land, and i will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, i will give all these countries, and i will perform the oath which i sware unto abraham thy father;
target_text: "tiko ga ena vanua oqo, au na tiko vata kei iko ka vakalouvinakataki iko; vei iko kei ira na nomu kawa, au na solia kina na vanua oqo, au na vakayacora kina na yalayala. au a bubului kina vei eparaama na tamamu.

source_text: and i will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;
target_text: "au na vakavuna na nomu kawa me ra vaka na kalokalo ni lomalagi; au na solia vei ira na nomu kawa na vanua taucoko oqo; mai vei iko, ena vakalouvinakataki kina na veivanua kece oqo;

source_text: because that abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
target_text: "baleta ni sa talairawarawa o eparaama ki na domoqu ka maroroya na noqu i lesilesi, na noqu i vakaro, na noqu lewa kei na noqu i vunau. "

source_text: and isaac dwelt in gerar:
target_text: o aisake sa tiko ga e qerari.

source_text: and the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, she is my sister: for he feared to say, she is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.
target_text: o ira na tagane ni vanua o ya era sa tarogi koya me baleta na watina. sa tukuna kina, "o koya na ganequ" â€œni sa rere o koya me tukuna, "o koya na watiqu; " ni sa nanuma "ni ra na vakamatei koya ena vuku i rapeka na watina, baleta ni sa rui yalewa totoka dina ni vakasaravi. "

source_text: and it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that abimelech king of the philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, isaac was sporting with rebekah his wife.
target_text: sa yaco, ni sa dede tiko na nodra tiko e kea, o apimeleki na tui filisitia, ni sa rai tiko yani ena nona katuba leka â€œsa raica ni rau sa veiwedevi tiko o aisake kei rapeka na watina.

source_text: and abimelech called isaac, and said, behold, of a surety she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, she is my sister? and isaac said unto him, because i said, lest i die for her.
target_text: o apimeleki sa kacivi aisake yani ka tukuna, "e vaka vei au ni rapeka e watimu; o tukuna rawa vakacava vei au ni o koya e ganemu? " sa tukuna vua o aisake, "baleta ni'u sa kila, 'de ra na vakamatei au ena vukui rapeka. '"

source_text: and abimelech said, what is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with thy wife, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o apimeleki, "na cava o sa cakava oqo vei keimami? vaka cava kevaka e dua sa moceri koya, o iko ga sa na kauta mai vei keimami na bula e beitaki. "

source_text: and abimelech charged all his people, saying, he that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
target_text: sa vakarota kina o apimeleki vei ira na nona tamata, "o koya sa tara na watina na tamata oqo, ena vakamatei vakaidina. "

source_text: then isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the lord blessed him.
target_text: sa kakaburaki ena vanua o ya o aisake, ka sa tatamusuki ena yabaki vata ga o ya â€œka sa yayadrau; sa vakalouvinakataki koya o jiova.

source_text: and the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
target_text: sa tubu cake na nona sautu, sa gumatua tikotikoga me yacova ni sa sautu vakalevu sara;

source_text: for he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants: and the philistines envied him.
target_text: ni sa taukena na qele ni manumanu, na qele ni bulumakau, ka sa levu sara na nona dauveiqaravi. era sa vuvutaki koya na kai filisitia.

source_text: for all the wells which his father's servants had digged in the days of abraham his father, the philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.
target_text: o ira na filisitia era sa sogota na vei mata ni wai kece era a kelia na tamata nei eparaama na tamana, era sa buluta kece ena qele.

source_text: and abimelech said unto isaac, go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.
target_text: sa tukuna o apimeleki vei aisake, "mo lako tani mai vei keimami, ni o sa rui kaukauwa mai vei keimami. "

source_text: and isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of gerar, and dwelt there.
target_text: sa lako tani mai kea o aisake ka la'ki tiko ena veibuca mai qerari.

source_text: and isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of abraham his father; for the philistines had stopped them after the death of abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
target_text: sa kelia tale o aisake na veimata ni wai, ea kelia e liu o eparaama na tamana, ni ra sa sogota na filisitia e na nona sa mate o eparaama. o aisake sa vakayacana tale ena yaca ga ea vakayacana kina e liu o tamana.

source_text: and isaac's servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
target_text: o ira talega na tamata i aisake, era sa kelia e dua na mata ni wai sa drodro tu ga, mai na buca.

source_text: and the herdmen of gerar did strive with isaac's herdmen, saying, the water is ours: and he called the name of the well esek; because they strove with him.
target_text: o ira na dau susu manumanu mai qerari era sa veivala kei ira na dau susu manumanu nei aisake ka tukuna, "na wai sa neimami" sa vakayacani kina na wai o ya me eseki, baleta ni ra sa veivala kei koya.

source_text: and they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it sitnah.
target_text: era sa kelia tale e dua na mata ni wai â€œera sa veivala tale kina. sa vakayacana o aisake na vanua o ya me sitina.

source_text: and he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it rehoboth; and he said, for now the lord hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
target_text: sa lako tani mai kea ka kelia tale e dua na mata ni wai â€œera sa sega ni veivala kina, sa vakayacana me reopoci, ni sa tukuna "o jiova sa solia na galala vei keda, eda na vuavuai kina ena vanua. "

source_text: and he went up from thence to beersheba.
target_text: sa lako cake mai kea ki periesepa.

source_text: and the lord appeared unto him the same night, and said, i am the god of abraham thy father: fear not, for i am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant abraham's sake.
target_text: o jiova sa basika vua ena bogi tiko ga o ya ka tukuna, "oi au na kalou nei tamamu o eparaama; kua ni rere, au sa tiko vata kei iko. au na vakalouvinakataki iko ka vakalewelevutaki iko kei ira na nomu kawa, ena vuku i eparaama. "

source_text: and he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the lord, and pitched his tent there: and there isaac's servants digged a well.
target_text: sa tara mai kea e dua nai cabocabo ni soro ka kaciva mai kea na yaca i jiova. sa tara talega e kea na nona valelaca; era sa kelia mai kea e dua na mata ni wai na dauveiqaravi nei aisake.

source_text: then abimelech went to him from gerar, and ahuzzath one of his friends, and phichol the chief captain of his army.
target_text: o apimeleki sa lako mai vua mai qerari vata kei ausaci, e dua na nona i tokani kei fikoli nai liuliu ni nona mataivalu.

source_text: and isaac said unto them, wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?
target_text: sa tukuna vei iratou o aisake, "na cava dou sa mai cakava vei au â€œkemudou a cati au ka vakatalai au tani mai vei kemudou? "

source_text: and they said, we saw certainly that the lord was with thee: and we said, let there be now an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
target_text: e ratou sa sauma mai, "keitou sa raica vakaidina ni sa tiko vata kei iko o jiova. keitou sa tukuna kina, me dua na nodatou veiyalayalati â€œo iko kei keitou. 'me datou cakava e dua na veiyalayalati,

source_text: that thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the lord.
target_text: 'mo kua ni cakava vei keitou e dua na ka ca â€œni keitou sa sega ni tarai iko. ni keitou sa sega ni cakava e dua na ka ca, na ka vinaka ga â€œni keitou sa vakatalai iko ena vakacegu. o sa kalouvinaka kina i jiova. '"

source_text: and he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
target_text: sa cakava o aisake e dua na kakana, e ratou sa kana ka gunu.

source_text: and they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
target_text: e ratou sa yadra ena mataka, ka veiyalayalati, sa vakatalai iratou yani; e ratou sa lako tani mai vua ena vakacegu.

source_text: and it came to pass the same day, that isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, we have found water.
target_text: ena siga tiko ga o ya, era sa lako mai na tamata nei aisake ka tukuna vua me baleta na mata ni wai era a kelia, era sa mai tukuna, "sa vure na wai. "

source_text: and he called it shebah: therefore the name of the city is beersheba unto this day.
target_text: sa vakatoka ena yaca o siepa. sa yaca ni koro kina o ya o perisiepa.

source_text: and esau was forty years old when he took to wife judith the daughter of beeri the hittite, and bashemath the daughter of elon the hittite:
target_text: ni sa yabaki vasagavulu o iso, sa tauri jutia na luvei bieri na itaiti, kei vasemaca na luvei eloni na itaiti, me rau watina.

source_text: which were a grief of mind unto isaac and to rebekah.
target_text: e rau sa rarawa kina vakalevu o aisake kei rapeka.

source_text: and it came to pass, that when isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called esau his eldest son, and said unto him, my son: and he said unto him, behold, here am i.
target_text: sa yaco na gauna ni sa qase mai o aisake ka sa buwawa sara na matana â€œsa sega kina ni rai rawa, sa kacivi iso mai, na nona ulumatua ka tukuna vua, "na luvequ, " sa sauma mai o iso, "sai au oqo. "

source_text: and he said, behold now, i am old, i know not the day of my death:
target_text: sa tukuna tale, "raica, au sa qase sara, au sa sega talega ni kila na noqu siga ni mate.

source_text: now therefore take, i pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;
target_text: "oqo mo kauta mada na nomu i yaragi, na taga ni gasau kei na veqa ni dakai, lako yani ka vakasasataka mada mai e dua na kequ manumanu.

source_text: and make me savoury meat, such as i love, and bring it to me, that i may eat; that my soul may bless thee before i die.
target_text: "mo tavuna vakaveiwaki mai, me vaka au sa dau vinakata, kauta mai, me'u mai kania, me vakalouvinakataki iko kina na yaloqu ni bera ni'u mate. "

source_text: and rebekah heard when isaac spake to esau his son. and esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
target_text: sa vakarorogo tu o rapeka ni sa vosa tiko o aisake vei iso na luvena. sa lako yani o iso ki vanua me vavana ka me kauta lesu mai.

source_text: and rebekah spake unto jacob her son, saying, behold, i heard thy father speak unto esau thy brother, saying,
target_text: o rapeka sa vosa vei jekope na luvena ka vaka: "au sa rogoci tamamu ni sa vosa oti vei iso na tacimu ka vaka,

source_text: bring me venison, and make me savoury meat, that i may eat, and bless thee before the lord before my death.
target_text: 'kauta mai e dua na manumanu, mo tavuna veiwaki ka kauta mai me'u kania ka vosa vakalouvinakataki iko ena mata i jiova ni bera ni'u mate. '

source_text: now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which i command thee.
target_text: "na luvequ mo rogoca na noqu vosa, me vaka au sa vakarota vei iko.

source_text: go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and i will make them savoury meat for thy father, such as he loveth:
target_text: "lako ka kauta mai e rua na luve ni me vinaka, au na tavuna veiwakitaka me kania o tamamu me vaka e dau vinakata.

source_text: and thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.
target_text: "mo qai kauta vei tamamu, me kania, ka vosa vakalouvinakataki iko ni bera ni mate yani. "

source_text: and jacob said to rebekah his mother, behold, esau my brother is a hairy man, and i am a smooth man:
target_text: sa tukuna o jekope vei tinana â€œ"raica, o iso e vutivutia na yagona, o au, e sega.

source_text: my father peradventure will feel me, and i shall seem to him as a deceiver; and i shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
target_text: "de qai vakayamoca o tamaqu na ligaqu, ka kilai au â€œena qai tukuna ni'u tamata dauveivakaisini, oqo au na kauta ga mai kina vei au na kalouca ka sega na kalouvinaka. "

source_text: and his mother said unto him, upon me be thy curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.
target_text: sa tukuna vua o tinana, "na nomu kalouca me noqu na luvequ, cakava ga na veika au sa tukuna oti vei iko, lako, kauta mai na manumanu. "

source_text: and he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury meat, such as his father loved.
target_text: sa lako yani o jekope, ka kauta mai na manumanu vei tinana. sa vakarautaka o tinana me vaka sara ga sa dautaleitaka o aisake.

source_text: and rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon jacob her younger son:
target_text: sa kauta mai o tinana nai sulu vinaka nei iso sa tiko ga vua e vale, ka sa vakasulumi jekope kina.

source_text: and she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:
target_text: sa vakabira tu e ligana na vuti ni me kei na domona talega.

source_text: and she gave the savoury meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son jacob.
target_text: sa solia na kakana kei na madrai ea vakarautaka mai ki na ligai jekope na luvena.

source_text: and he came unto his father, and said, my father: and he said, here am i; who art thou, my son?
target_text: sa lako yani o jekope vei tamana ka tukuna, "tamaqu, " sa sauma mai, "oi au oqo, o cei o iko na luvequ? "

source_text: and jacob said unto his father, i am esau thy firstborn; i have done according as thou badest me: arise, i pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
target_text: sa tukuna o jekope vei tamana, "oi au o iso, na nomu ulumatua, au sa cakava mai oqo, me vaka o sa tukuna mai, au kerea mo duri cake, mo dabe, mo kania na ka au sa vakarautaka mai. me vakalouvinakataki au kina na yalomu. "

source_text: and isaac said unto his son, how is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? and he said, because the lord thy god brought it to me.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o aisake vei luvena, "o sa kunea vakacava, sa rui totolo na veika o cakava? " sa sauma yani o jekope, "na kalou o jiova sa kauta mai vei au. "

source_text: and isaac said unto jacob, come near, i pray thee, that i may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son esau or not.
target_text: sa tukuna tale o aisake, "toso voleka mai me'u yamoca na ligamu, se o iko dina o iso se sega. "

source_text: and jacob went near unto isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, the voice is jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of esau.
target_text: sa toso voleka yani vei tamana o jekope, ka sa yamoci koya sara o tamana ka tukuna, "na domo sa domo i jekope, ia, na ligana sa ligai iso ga. "

source_text: and he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother esau's hands: so he blessed him.
target_text: sa sega ni kilai koya baleta ni sa vutivutia na ligana me vaka na ligai iso. sa qai vosa vakalouvinakataki koya.

source_text: and he said, art thou my very son esau? and he said, i am.
target_text: sa qai tukuna yani, "sai iko dina oqo, iso na luvequ? " sa sauma mai o jekope, "sai au. "

source_text: and he said, bring it near to me, and i will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless thee. and he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
target_text: sa tukuna o aisake, "kauta mai, me'u mai kania na ka o sa vakarautaka mai â€œme vakalouvinakataki iko kina na yaloqu. " sa kauta mai o jekope, sa kana sara o aisake, sa kau talega mai vua na waini ka sa gunu talega.

source_text: and his father isaac said unto him, come near now, and kiss me, my son.
target_text: o aisake na tamana sa tukuna vua, "toso voleka mai ka reguci au, na luvequ. "

source_text: and he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, see, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the lord hath blessed:
target_text: sa toso voleka mai o jekope ka reguci tamana. sa boica na nona i sulu o aisake, ka vosa vakalouvinakataki koya ka vaka: "nai boi kei na luvequ, sa vaka nai boi ni vanua sa vakalouvinakataka o jiova.

source_text: therefore god give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:
target_text: o koya oqo me solia kina vei iko o jiova na tegu mai lomalagi, na vuavuai vinaka kei vuravura, me levu na sila kei na waini.

source_text: let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
target_text: me ra qaravi iko na tamata, ka cuva vei iko na veimatanitu, o na turaga vei ira na tacimu, o ira na luvei tinamu era na cuva vei iko, era na kalouca o ira era na vakaloucataki iko, era na kalouvinaka o ira era na vakalouvinakataki iko! "

source_text: and it came to pass, as soon as isaac had made an end of blessing jacob, and jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of isaac his father, that esau his brother came in from his hunting.
target_text: ni sa oti na nona vakalouvinakataki jekope o aisake ka sa curu yani ki tuba mai vei aisake na tamana â€œsa basika mai o iso ena nona lesu tiko mai na vakasasa.

source_text: and he also had made savoury meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that thy soul may bless me.
target_text: sa vakarautaka sara mai vakavinaka na nona lewe ni vakasasa ka kauta mai vei tamana ka tukuna, "me duri mada na tamaqu ka kania mada na lewe ni vakasasa na luvena, me rawa ni vakalouvinakataka kina na luvena mai na yalona. "

source_text: and isaac his father said unto him, who art thou? and he said, i am thy son, thy firstborn esau.
target_text: sa tarogi koya o aisake na tamana, "o cei o iko? " sa sauma mai, "o au na luvemu ulumatua, o iso. "

source_text: and isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and i have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.
target_text: sa kidacala o aisake ka sautaninini, ka tukuna, "o cei? sa e vei o koya sa vakasasa oti ka liu mai, ka sa kauta oti mai vei au? au sa kana oti ni se bera ni o lako mai, au sa vakalouvinakataki koya â€œsa vakalouvinakataki dina o koya. "

source_text: and when esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, bless me, even me also, o my father.
target_text: ni sa rogoca oiso na vosa nei tamana, sa tagi vakararawa sara ka tukuna vei tamana "o au talega tamaqu, mo vakalouvinakataki au? "

source_text: and he said, thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.
target_text: sa tukuna o aisake, "sa lako mai o tacimu ena veivakaisini, ka sa kauta tani na nomu vakalouvinakataki. "

source_text: and he said, is not he rightly named jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. and he said, hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
target_text: sa tukuna tale o iso, "sa sega li ni vakayacani donu o jekope? ni sa vakaisini (jekope) au vaka rua oqo â€œsa kauta tani na noqu i tutu vakaulumatua, oqo, sa kauta talega na noqu vakalouvinakataki! " sa tukuna talega, "ka o sega ni bau biuta tu vei au edua na ka me noqui votavota? "

source_text: and isaac answered and said unto esau, behold, i have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have i given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have i sustained him: and what shall i do now unto thee, my son?
target_text: sa sauma mai o aisake ka tukuna vei iso, "raica, au sa cakava me nomu turaga o koya, o ira kece na tacina, me ra nona i talai, na sila kei na waini me maroroi koya â€œna cava tale me'u cakava vei iko na luvequ? "

source_text: and esau said unto his father, hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, o my father. and esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
target_text: sa tukuna o iso vei tamana, "sa tu beka ga vei iko e dua na vosa ni veivakalouvinakataki? e sega ni rawa vei iko mo vakalouvinakataki au talega tamaqu! " sa tagi vakadomoilevu sara o iso.

source_text: and isaac his father answered and said unto him, behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;
target_text: sa sauma mai o aisake na tamana ka tukuna vua, "raica na nomu i tikotiko, ena vanua vuavuai e vuravura, kei na kena tegu mai lomalagi e na lutu tiko ga mai.

source_text: and by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
target_text: o na bula ena nomu i seleiwau, ka o na qaravi tacimu; ena yaco na gauna ni o sa sega ni kunea na vakacegu, - o na musuka tani na nona i vua mai na domomu. "

source_text: and esau hated jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and esau said in his heart, the days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will i slay my brother jacob.
target_text: o iso sa cati jekope vakalevu ena vuku ni veivakalouvinakataki sa solia vua o tamana (aisake), sa tukuna kina e lomana o iso, "sa voleka oqo na siga ni so mate vei tamaqu, ni oti o ya, au na qai vakamatei jekope. "

source_text: and these words of esau her elder son were told to rebekah: and she sent and called jacob her younger son, and said unto him, behold, thy brother esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
target_text: sa tukuni vei rapeka na vosa oqo nei iso. sa kacivi jekope mai ka tukuna vua, "raica sa vakamalumalumutaki koya tiko o iso ena vukumu â€œni sa nakita tiko me vakamatei iko.

source_text: now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to laban my brother to haran;
target_text: "oqo na luvequ â€œrogoca na noqu vosa, tucake, dro ki vei lepani na ganequ ki arana.

source_text: and tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away;
target_text: "tiko mai kea me vica na siga, qai lesu mai ni sa oti na nona cudru,

source_text: until thy brother's anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then i will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should i be deprived also of you both in one day?
target_text: "ni sa oti na nona cudru ka sa guilecava talega, au na qai talatala yani mo lako mai. na cava me'u rarawa kina vakalevu ena dua ga na siga? "

source_text: and rebekah said to isaac, i am weary of my life because of the daughters of heth: if jacob take a wife of the daughters of heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
target_text: o rapeka sa tukuna vei aisake, "au sa rarawa tiko vakalevu ena vukudra na luvei eci yalewa; kevaka sa wati jekope e dua na luvei eci â€œme vakataki ira na goneyalewa ni vanua oqo. ena vinaka vakacava na noqu bula vei au? "

source_text: and isaac called jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of canaan.
target_text: o aisake sa kacivi jekope ka vosa vakalouvinakataki koya ka vakaroti koya ka tukuna, "mo kua ni taura e dua me watimu, ena vanua oqo o kenani.

source_text: arise, go to padanaram, to the house of bethuel thy mother's father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of laban thy mother's brother.
target_text: "mo lako ki na vanua o padani-erami ki na vale nei pecueli (tukamu) na tama i tinamu; ka taura mai kea e dua na watimu, mai na vale nei lepani na ganei tinamu.

source_text: and god almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people;
target_text: "na kalou kaukauwa, me vakalouvinakataki iko, ka mo yagavakalevu ka vuavuai, mo vakalewelevutaki talega â€œmo dua nai soqosoqo tamata;

source_text: and give thee the blessing of abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which god gave unto abraham.
target_text: me soli talega vei iko na veivakalouvinakataki i eparaama, vei iko kei ira talega na nomu kawa era na muri iko mai â€œmo taukena kina na vanua o tiko vulagi kina, na vanua sa solia na kalou vei eparaama. "

source_text: and isaac sent away jacob: and he went to padanaram unto laban, son of bethuel the syrian, the brother of rebekah, jacob's and esau's mother.
target_text: sa vakatalai jekope yani o aisake, ka sa lako sara ki padani-erami vei lepani na luvei petueli na kai siria na ganei rapeka na tinadrau o jekope kei iso.

source_text: when esau saw that isaac had blessed jacob, and sent him away to padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of canaan;
target_text: o iso sa raici aisake ni sa vakalouvinakataki jekope ka sa vakatala yani ki padanierami me taura mai kea e dua na watina, ni sa tukuna, "mo kua ni taura me watimu e dua na yalewa ni kenani, "

source_text: and that jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to padanaram;
target_text: ka sa talairawarawa vei tamana kei tinana o jekope ni sa lako yani ki padani-erami.

source_text: and esau seeing that the daughters of canaan pleased not isaac his father;
target_text: sa raica talega o iso, ni sa sega ni vinakati ira na yalewa ni kenani o tamana o aisake.

source_text: then went esau unto ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had mahalath the daughter of ishmael abraham's son, the sister of nebajoth, to be his wife.
target_text: o iso sa lako yani vei isimeli ka tauri maelaci na luvei isimeli, na luvei eparaama, na ganei nebatoce me watina, ka sai kuri ni watina era sa tiko rawa.

source_text: and jacob went out from beersheba, and went toward haran.
target_text: sa lako tani o jekope mai periesepa ka lako vaka ki arana.

source_text: and he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.
target_text: sa yaco ki na dua na vanua ka tiko kina ena bogi taucoko, baleta ni sa dromu na mata ni siga. sa taura e dua na vatu me nona i lokoloko ka davo sobu me moce.

source_text: and he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of god ascending and descending on it.
target_text: sa qai tadra, ka raica ni sa dua nai kabakaba sa lako yani e vuravura ka yacovi lomalagi, kei ira na agilosi ni kalou era sa veilakoyaki tiko kina â€œlako cake ka lako sobu mai.

source_text: and, behold, the lord stood above it, and said, i am the lord god of abraham thy father, and the god of isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will i give it, and to thy seed;
target_text: o jiova sa tu mai cake ka tukuna: "oi au o jiova na kalou i eparaama, na kalou i aisake. na qele o davoca tiko oqori, au na solia vei iko kei ira na nomu kawa.

source_text: and thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
target_text: "o ira talega na nomu kawa era na vaka na kuvu ni qele (kedra i wiliwili); o na tete vaka ki na ra, ki na tokalau, ki na vualiku ki na ceva talega. mai vei iko kei ira na nomu kawa, ena vakalouvinakataki kina o vuravura taucoko.

source_text: and, behold, i am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for i will not leave thee, until i have done that which i have spoken to thee of.
target_text: "raica, au sa tiko vata kei iko, me'u maroroi iko ena vanua kecega o sa na lako kina ka au na kauti iko lesu tale mai ki na vanua oqo, au na sega ni laivi iko me yacova ni'u sa cakava kece na veika au sa vosa kina vei iko. "

source_text: and jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, surely the lord is in this place; and i knew it not.
target_text: sa yadra vakasauri o jekope mai na nona moce ka tukuna, "sa dina, o jiova sa tiko eke ka au sa sega tu ni kila. "

source_text: and he was afraid, and said, how dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of god, and this is the gate of heaven.
target_text: sa rerevaka levu ka tukuna, "sa vanua vinaka dina oqo, sa sega tale ni dua na ka oqo â€œna vale ni kalou ga â€œoqo sara ga na matamata ki lomalagi! "

source_text: and jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
target_text: sa yadra vakamataka lailai o jekope, sa taura na vatu (nona i lokoloko) sa vakaduria me duru, ka sa lumuta ena waiwai.

source_text: and he called the name of that place bethel: but the name of that city was called luz at the first.
target_text: sa vakatoka na yaca ni vanua o ya me peceli; na yaca ni vanua o ya e liu o luse.

source_text: and jacob vowed a vow, saying, if god will be with me, and will keep me in this way that i go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
target_text: sa yalayala (bubului) o jekope ka vaka: "kevaka sa tiko vata kei au na kalou, ka maroroi au ena sala au sa lakova tiko oqo, ka solia vei au na kakana me'u kania kei nai sulu me'u suluma,

source_text: so that i come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the lord be my god:
target_text: "me'u lesu tale mai kina ki na vale nei tamaqu ena vakacegu â€œo jiova, sa na noqu kalou.

source_text: and this stone, which i have set for a pillar, shall be god's house: and of all that thou shalt give me i will surely give the tenth unto thee.
target_text: "na vatu oqo au sa vakaduria me duru, sa na vale ni kalou. na veika kece o ni na solia vei au, na kena i katini (sigana) au na solia vakaidina vei kemuni. "

source_text: then jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.
target_text: o jekope sa lako ena nona i lakolako ka sa yaco ki na nodra vanua na tamata mai na tokalau.

source_text: and he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great stone was upon the well's mouth.
target_text: sa rai yani ka raica e dua na mata ni wai ena buca; era sa davo voleka tu kina e tolu na qele ni sipi. era sa dau gunu na sipi mai na mata ni wai oqori. e dua na vatu levu sa ubi tu kina na mata ni wai.

source_text: and thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well's mouth in his place.
target_text: era sa dau lako yani ki kea na qele ni manumanu, sa dau vakaqiqici tani na vatu mai na gusu ni mata ni wai, era sa dau gunu na sipi ka sogo tale na mata ni wai ena vatu.

source_text: and jacob said unto them, my brethren, whence be ye? and they said, of haran are we.
target_text: sa taro yani vei ira o jekope, "kemudou na taciqu, oi kemudou sara mada mai vei? " e ratou sa sauma, "mai arana. "

source_text: and he said unto them, know ye laban the son of nahor? and they said, we know him.
target_text: sa qai taro tale vei iratou, "dou sa kilai lepani beka, na luvei neori? " e ratou sa sauma mai, "keitou sa kilai koya. "

source_text: and he said unto them, is he well? and they said, he is well: and, behold, rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.
target_text: "sa vinaka tiko beka o koya se sega? " e ratou sa sauma mai, "io, sa bula vinaka o koya, raica o raijeli na luvena yalewa sa lako tiko mai oqori kei ira na sipi. "

source_text: and he said, lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.
target_text: sa tukuna sara o jekope, "raica e se sigalevu tutu na vanua, e se sega ni kena gauna me ra kacivi vata mai na sipi. me ra gunu na sipi ka dou vakania talega. "

source_text: and they said, we cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and till they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.
target_text: e ratou sa tukuna mai, "keitou na sega ni cakava oqori, vakavo ke sa soqoni vata kece mai na manumanu, ka vakaqiqici tani na vatu mai na gusu ni mata ni wai, era na qai gunu. "

source_text: and while he yet spake with them, rachel came with her father's sheep: for she kept them.
target_text: ni se vosa tiko ga vei ira, sa lako mai o raijeli kei na sipi nei tamana â€œni sa dau qarava na vakatawani ni sipi.

source_text: and it came to pass, when jacob saw rachel the daughter of laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of laban his mother's brother, that jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of laban his mother's brother.
target_text: o jekope ni sa raici raijeli, na luvei lepani na ganei tinana, kei na sipi nei lepani, sa toso yani o jekope ka vakaqiqica tani na vatu mai na mata ni wai, ka vakagunuvi ira na sipi nei lepani.

source_text: and jacob kissed rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
target_text: o jekope sa reguci raijeli, ka sa tagi.

source_text: and jacob told rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was rebekah's son: and she ran and told her father.
target_text: o jekope sa tukuna vei raijeli ni o koya na wekai lepani, ka ni sa luvei rapeka. sa cici yani o raijeli ka tukuna vei tamana.

source_text: and it came to pass, when laban heard the tidings of jacob his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. and he told laban all these things.
target_text: ni sa rogoca o lepani nai tukutuku kei jekope na luvei ganena, sa cici sara yani me sotavi koya. sa mokoti koya ka reguci koya ka kauti koya sara yani ki nona vale. sa tukuna o jekope na veika kece vei lepani.

source_text: and laban said to him, surely thou art my bone and my flesh. and he abode with him the space of a month.
target_text: sa tukuna vua o lepani, "e dina, e daru sa sui vata ka lewe vata. " sa tiko e kea o jekope me vula dua.

source_text: and laban said unto jacob, because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?
target_text: sa tukuna o lepani vei jekope, "baleta ni o sa wekaqu, e dodonu beka mo cakacaka wale vei au? tukuna mada vei au, na cava me kemu i sau? "

source_text: and laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was leah, and the name of the younger was rachel.
target_text: o lepani sa rua tiko na luvena yalewa: sa qase o lia ka gone o raijeli.

source_text: leah was tender eyed; but rachel was beautiful and well favoured.
target_text: sa mata kamica o lia, ia, o raijeli sa rui totoka qai talei na kena i rairai.

source_text: and jacob loved rachel; and said, i will serve thee seven years for rachel thy younger daughter.
target_text: o jekope e taleitaki raijeli vakalevu ka tukuna, "au na qaravi iko me vitu na yabaki ena vuku i raijeli na luvemu yalewa gone. "

source_text: and laban said, it is better that i give her to thee, than that i should give her to another man: abide with me.
target_text: sa sauma o lepani, "e vinaka me'u solia na luvequ vei iko â€œka sega ni vua tale e dua na tagane. mo tiko mada vata kei au. "

source_text: and jacob served seven years for rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
target_text: sa cakacakataka na vitu na yabaki o jekope ena vuku i raijeli â€œsa vaka ga e vica na siga na vitu na yabaki oqori, baleta ni sa rui vinakati raijeli vakalevu.

source_text: and jacob said unto laban, give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that i may go in unto her.
target_text: o jekope sa tukuna vei lepani, "solia vei au na watiqu, ni sa oti na noqu veisiga ni veiqaravi, ni'u sa vinakata me curumi koya. "

source_text: and laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
target_text: sa kacivi ira kece mai na tamata o lepani, ka cakava e dua na kakana levu.

source_text: and it came to pass in the evening, that he took leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
target_text: ni sa yakavi bogi mai, sa tauri lia ka kauti koya mai vei jekope. sa curumi koya sara o jekope.

source_text: and laban gave unto his daughter leah zilpah his maid for an handmaid.
target_text: o lepani sa soli siliva na nona dauveiqaravi me dauveiqaravi nei lia.

source_text: and it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was leah: and he said to laban, what is this thou hast done unto me? did not i serve with thee for rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
target_text: ni sa mataka mai, sa kila o jekope ni sa i lia ka sega ni o raijeli. sa tarogi lepani sara, "na cava o sa cakava vei au? e sega beka ni au a cakacaka ena vuku i raijeli? na cava o sa vakaisini au kina? "

source_text: and laban said, it must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
target_text: sa sauma o lepani, "e sega ni dodonu me caka oqo, ena neimami vanua â€œme dau soli e liu na gone mai vua na qase.

source_text: fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
target_text: "mo cakacakataka talega na nona gauna, me qai soli kina vei iko. "

source_text: and jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him rachel his daughter to wife also.
target_text: sa qai cakacakataka o jekope na vitu tale na yabaki, sa qai soli vei koya o raijeli me watina.

source_text: and laban gave to rachel his daughter bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.
target_text: o lepani sa soli bila na nona dauveiqaravi, me dauveiqaravi nei raijeli.

source_text: and he went in also unto rachel, and he loved also rachel more than leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
target_text: sa curumi raijeli o jekope ni sa taleitaki koya vakalevu, ni sa qaravi lepani ena vitu tale na yabaki.

source_text: and when the lord saw that leah was hated, he opened her womb: but rachel was barren.
target_text: ni sa raica o jiova ni sega ni lomani vakalevu o lia â€œna kalou sa qai dolava na kato ni gone nei lia, qai sogota na kato nei raijeli.

source_text: and leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name reuben: for she said, surely the lord hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.
target_text: sa kunekune o lia ka vakasucuma e dua na tagane, ka vakayacani koya me o rupeni; ni sa tukuna, "o jiova sa raica dina na noqu rarawa. oqo ena lomani au kina o na watiqu jekope. "

source_text: and she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, because the lord hath heard that i was hated, he hath therefore given me this son also: and she called his name simeon.
target_text: sa kunekune tale ka vakasucuma e dua na tagane ka tukuna, "o jiova sa rogoca ni'u sa sega ni lomani. oqo sa solia kina vei au e dua tale na tagane. " sa yacana o simione.

source_text: and she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because i have born him three sons: therefore was his name called levi.
target_text: sa kunekune ka vakasucuma tale e dua na tagane, sa tukuna kina, "oqo sa na qai kabiti au kina o watiqu (jekope), baleta ni'u sa vakasucuma vua e tolu na gone tagane. " sa yacana o livai.

source_text: and she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, now will i praise the lord: therefore she called his name judah; and left bearing.
target_text: sa kunekune tale ka vakasucuma e dua tale na tagane, sa tukuna kina, "oqo au na vakavinavinaka vua na kalou. " sa vakayacana kina na gone me o juta. sa qai tu vakadua na nona vakasucu gone.

source_text: and when rachel saw that she bare jacob no children, rachel envied her sister; and said unto jacob, give me children, or else i die.
target_text: ni sa raica o raijeli ni sa sega tiko ni vakaluveni vei jekope, sa vuvutaki tuakana vakalevu, sa tukuna vei jekope, "solia vei au e dua na gone, de'u na qai mate! "
