source_text: and they took joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;
target_text: era sa taura na kote i joseva, ka vakamatea e dua na me, sa qai toni na kote ena kena dra.

source_text: and they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father; and said, this have we found: know now whether it be thy son's coat or no.
target_text: era sa vakauta mai na kote vei tamadra ka tukuna, "keimami sa kunea oqo, mo raica oqo, e nei luvemu se sega? "

source_text: and he knew it, and said, it is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
target_text: sa kila o jekope ka tukuna, "oqo na kote nei luvequ, e dua na manumanu kila sa kani koya, sa sega ni cala, o joseva sa basuki vakalalai. "

source_text: and jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
target_text: sa basuraka na nona i sulu o jekope ka vakaisulu taga na tolona ka lolokutaki joseva me vica vata na siga.

source_text: and all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, for i will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. thus his father wept for him.
target_text: o ira kece na luvena era sa mai vakacegui koya, sa tukuna o jekope, "au na lako sobu ki nai bulubulu vei luvequ ena vakaloloku. " sa tagi o jekope ena vukuna.

source_text: and the midianites sold him into egypt unto potiphar, an officer of pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.
target_text: o ira na mitiani era sa volitaki joseva sara ki ijipita vei potifa na vakai lesilesi i fero ka sa nodra i liuliu na mata yadra.

source_text: and it came to pass at that time, that judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain adullamite, whose name was hirah.
target_text: sa yaco ena dua na gauna sa lako tani mai kina o juta mai vei ira na tacina, sa sikova yani e dua mai etulama na yacana o ira.

source_text: and judah saw there a daughter of a certain canaanite, whose name was shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.
target_text: sa raica talega mai kea e dua na goneyalewa ni kenani, na luvei sua, sa vakawatitaki koya ka curumi koya sara.

source_text: and she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name er.
target_text: sa kunekune ka vakasucuma vua e dua na luvena talega sa yacana o eri.

source_text: and she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name onan.
target_text: sa kunekune tale, ka vakasucuma e dua na tagane, sa vakayacani koya o tinana me o onani.

source_text: and she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name shelah: and he was at chezib, when she bare him.
target_text: sa dua tale na luvena tagane, sa yacana o sela. sa tiko mai jesiba ena gauna sa sucu kina o sela.

source_text: and judah took a wife for er his firstborn, whose name was tamar.
target_text: o juta sa kauta mai e dua na wati eri, na nona ulumatua, na yacana o tamare.

source_text: and er, judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the lord; and the lord slew him.
target_text: ia, o eri na ulumatua i juta, sa caka ca ena mata i jiova, o jiova ga sa vakamatei koya.

source_text: and judah said unto onan, go in unto thy brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
target_text: o juta sa tukuna vei onani, "lako vei wati tacimu, mo drau veiwatini, ka vakatubura e dua na kawa vei tacimu. "

source_text: and onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
target_text: sa kila o onami ni o na luvena ena sega ni nona, sa vakadrodroya kina qele, ena gauna sa curumi wati tacina tiko kina â€œde qai solia na kawa vei tacina.

source_text: and the thing which he did displeased the lord: wherefore he slew him also.
target_text: na veika oqo sa sega ni marautaka o jiova, oqo, sa vakamatei onani talega kina.

source_text: then said judah to tamar his daughter in law, remain a widow at thy father's house, till shelah my son be grown: for he said, lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. and tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
target_text: sa tukuna o juta vei vugona o tamare, "mo tiko yada mada ena vale i tamamu, " me yacova ni sa cauravou mai o sela. " de qai mate tale me vakataki tacina. " sa lako o tamare ka tiko wawa ena vale nei tamana.

source_text: and in process of time the daughter of shuah judah's wife died; and judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to timnath, he and his friend hirah the adullamite.
target_text: sa yaco na gauna sa mate kina na wati juta, sa vakacegui ka lako cake vei ira na nona dauvakatawa sipi e timana, o koya kei na nona i tokani o ira na kai etulama.

source_text: and it was told tamar, saying, behold thy father in law goeth up to timnath to shear his sheep.
target_text: sa tukuni vei tamare, "raica o nomu momo sa lako cake i timana me raica na nona sipi. "

source_text: and she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to timnath; for she saw that shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
target_text: sa luvata tani na nona i sulu vaka yada, sa ubi koya ka la'ki dabe tiko ena tikina lala ena sala vaka ki timana; ni sa raici sela sa cauravou levu mai â€œia sa sega ga ni lako yani me rau veiwatini.

source_text: when judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.
target_text: ni sa raici koya o juta, sa nanuma ni oqo e dua e volitaki koya tiko, baleta ni ubia tiko na matana taucoko.

source_text: and he turned unto her by the way, and said, go to, i pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law. ) and she said, what wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
target_text: sa vuki yani vua ena sala ka tukuna, "au kerea me'u curumi iko mada, " sa sega ni kila, o ya o na vugona. sa taroga o vugona, "na cava o na solia vei au, me rawa ni o curumi au kina? "

source_text: and he said, i will send thee a kid from the flock. and she said, wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
target_text: sa sauma mai, "au na solia mai e dua na me gone. " sa tukuna tale yani, "mo solia mai e dua na kena i vakadinadina? "

source_text: and he said, what pledge shall i give thee? and she said, thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. and he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
target_text: "na cava me'u solia vei iko? " sa sauma mai na nomu i taube/mama kei na nomu i titoko. " sa mani solia yani vua, ka curumi koya sara ka sa kunekune talega mai vua.

source_text: and she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
target_text: sa tucake ka lako yani, sa veisautaka na nona i sulu ka dara tale na nona i sulu vakayada.

source_text: and judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.
target_text: sa vakauta yani o juta na me gone, mai na ligana na nona i tokani na kai etulama vua na yalewa. ia, sa sega ga ni kune.

source_text: then he asked the men of that place, saying, where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? and they said, there was no harlot in this place.
target_text: sa tarogi ira na tagane ena vanua o ya, "e vei o koya na dau volivolitaki sa tu ena sala? " era sa sauma, "sa sega eke na dauvolivolitaki sa tu ena sala. "

source_text: and he returned to judah, and said, i cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
target_text: sa lesu tale yani vei juta ka tukuna, "au sa sega ni raici koya, o ira talega na tagane mai keau era sa tukuna ni sa sega na dauvolivolitaki vakaoqo ena vanua. "

source_text: and judah said, let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, i sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
target_text: sa tukuna o juta, "me sa taura ga yani o koya de daru na qai madua â€œni'u sa solia yani na me, ia sa yali o koya. "

source_text: and it came to pass about three months after, that it was told judah, saying, tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. and judah said, bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
target_text: ni sa oti tale e tolu na vula, sa tukuni sara vei juta ka vaka: "o tamare na vugomu ea volitaki koya ena sala ka sa bukete tiko. " sa tukuna yani o juta, "kauti koya mai me mai vakamai! "

source_text: when she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, by the man, whose these are, am i with child: and she said, discern, i pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
target_text: ni sa kau mai, sa tukuna vei nona momo, "o koya na tagane sa nona oqo, sa vakabuketetaki au, " mo raica mada se nei cei oqo, nai taube, mama kei na i titoko. "

source_text: and judah acknowledged them, and said, she hath been more righteous than i; because that i gave her not to shelah my son. and he knew her again no more.
target_text: sa tukuna o juta, ni sa kila ka sa tukuna, "sa yalododonu cake o koya mai vei au, ni'u sa sega ni soli koya vei sela baleta ni sa tamata levu mai. " sa sega ni curumi koya tale.

source_text: and it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
target_text: ena gauna me sa vakasucu kina, sa tiko e ketena e rua na gone.

source_text: and it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, this came out first.
target_text: ni sa vakasucu tiko, sa basika mai e dua na liga, o koya na dau ni veivakasucumi sa vesuka sara e dua na wa lokaloka e ligana ka tukuna, "oqo e liu mai. "

source_text: and it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, how hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called pharez.
target_text: na ka e yaco ni sa vakasuka lesu tale na ligana, sa basika mai o tacina vakasauri ni sega ni namaki, ka tukuna sara, "o lako mai vakacava? o takoso mai. " sa yacana kina me o veresi.

source_text: and afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called zarah.
target_text: ni oti oqo sa qai basika mai o tacina ni sa tiko e ligana na wa lokaloka. sa yacana o sira.

source_text: and joseph was brought down to egypt; and potiphar, an officer of pharaoh, captain of the guard, an egyptian, bought him of the hands of the ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.
target_text: sa kau sobu o joseva ki ijipita. o potifa nai vakalesilesi nei fero ka nodra i liuliu na mata yadra, sa voli koya mai vei ira na isimeli.

source_text: and the lord was with joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the egyptian.
target_text: sa tiko vata kei joseva o jiova. sa tamata yaco o koya; ka sa tiko ena vale ni nona turaga na kai ijipita.

source_text: and his master saw that the lord was with him, and that the lord made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
target_text: sa raica tiko na nona turaga ni sa tiko vata kei koya o jiova. o jiova sa vakavuna na vuavuai vinaka na veika sa tara tiko na ligana.

source_text: and joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
target_text: sa taleitaki tiko vakalevu o joseva mai vua na nona turaga. sa yaco me lewa taucoko na vale ni nona turaga.

source_text: and it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the lord blessed the egyptian's house for joseph's sake; and the blessing of the lord was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
target_text: sa yaco talega me vakalouvinakataka o jiova na nona vale na kai ijipita oqo, ena vuku i joseva, na kalouvinaka oqo sa tara yani na loma ni vale kei na vei ka e tuba.

source_text: and he left all that he had in joseph's hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. and joseph was a goodly person, and well favoured.
target_text: sa soli na veika kecega ki na ligai joseva, sa sega ni via kila tale e dua na ka, vakavo ga na madrai ni sa taura e ligana me kana. sa tamata rairai vinaka talega o joseva.

source_text: and it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon joseph; and she said, lie with me.
target_text: ni sa yaco tiko na veika oqo, na wati potifa sa domoni joseva vakalevu, sa mani tukuna kina vei joseva, "daru veidomoni mada. "

source_text: but he refused, and said unto his master's wife, behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;
target_text: sa bese o joseva ka tukuna, "raica na noqu turaga sa sega ni kila na ka kece sa tu oqo e vale, baleta ni sa solia kece tu oqo ki na ligaqu.

source_text: there is none greater in this house than i; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can i do this great wickedness, and sin against god?
target_text: "sa sega ni dua e uasivi vei au ena vale oqo, sa sega talega ni vakavoca vei au e dua na ka me'u lewa, au sa lewa kecega, vakavo duadua o iko, ni o sa watina. me'u cakava vakacava nai valavala ca levu oqo, nai valavala ca vua na kalou? "

source_text: and it came to pass, as she spake to joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
target_text: sa sagai joseva tikoga ena veisiga â€œsa sega ga ni via rogoci koya o joseva.

source_text: and it came to pass about this time, that joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
target_text: sa qai yaco ni sa lako tale yani o joseva me cakava na nona cakacaka e vale â€œsa sega na tagane me kune e vale,

source_text: and she caught him by his garment, saying, lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
target_text: sa vesuki joseva vata kei na nona i oro bale ka tukuna, "daru mai veicurumi mada. " sa biuta tu na nona i oro bale e ligana ka dro yani ki tuba.

source_text: and it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
target_text: sa qai yaco, ni sa raica ni sa biuta tu mai o joseva na nona i oro ena ligana ka dro yani ki tuba,

source_text: that she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, see, he hath brought in an hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and i cried with a loud voice:
target_text: sa kacivi ira mai na turaga ena vale ka tukuna vei ira, "raica sa kau mai vei keda e dua na iperiu oqo me vakalialiai keda. sa lako mai ka vakasagai au, ka vinakata me moceri au, au sa qai kaila vakadomoi levu.

source_text: and it came to pass, when he heard that i lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.
target_text: "ni sa rogoca o koya ni'u sa qoqolou, sa qai biuta tu mai na nona i oro ka dro yani ki tuba. "

source_text: and she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.
target_text: sa taura tiko ga na nona i oro me yacova ni sa lako mai na nona turaga ki vale.

source_text: and she spake unto him according to these words, saying, the hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
target_text: sa qai vosa vua me vaka oqo: "na iperiu dauveiqaravi o a kauta mai vei keda, sa lako mai vei au me vakalialiai au;

source_text: and it came to pass, as i lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.
target_text: "ena gauna au sa kaikaila kina, sa biuta tu mai na nona i oro ka dro yani ki tuba. "

source_text: and it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, after this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
target_text: ni sa rogoca o nona turaga na veika sa tukuna vua o watina ni sa tukuna, "na nomu tamata sa cakava vaka oqo vei au, " sa tubu sara na nona cudru.

source_text: and joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
target_text: na turaga i joseva sa tauri koya ka biuta ki vale ni veivesu. na vanua era sa tiko kina na kaivesu ni tui. sa tiko talega kina o joseva.

source_text: but the lord was with joseph, and shewed him mercy, and gave him favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
target_text: ia, o jiova sa tiko vata ga kei joseva, ka sa vakaraitaka tiko vua na nona loloma. sa solia tiko ga vei joseva na nona vinaka ena mata i koya na i vakatawa ni vale ni veivesu.

source_text: and the keeper of the prison committed to joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
target_text: nai vakatawa ni valeniveivesu sa solia kece ki na ligai joseva na lewa ni nodra bula kece na kaivesu; na ka kece era cakava sa nona lewa ga.

source_text: the keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the lord was with him, and that which he did, the lord made it to prosper.
target_text: sa sega tale ni via kila mai nai vakatawa ni valeniveivesu e dua na ka, baleta ni sa tiko vata kei koya o jiova. na veika kece e caka, sa vakagugumatuataka o jiova.

source_text: and it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of egypt and his baker had offended their lord the king of egypt.
target_text: sa qai yaco ena dua na gauna, o koya na dauvakarau mena waini kei koya na dau vavi kakana nei fero, e rau sa caka cala vua na nodrau turaga na tui ijipita.

source_text: and pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.
target_text: o fero sa cudruvi rau vakalevu na nona dauveiqaravi oqo, na i liuliu ni caka waini kei nai liuliu ni dauvavavi.

source_text: and he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where joseph was bound.
target_text: sa biuti rau ena ligai koya nai liuliu ni mata yadra ni valeniveivesu. ena vanua sa vesu tiko kina o joseva.

source_text: and the captain of the guard charged joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
target_text: nai liuliu ni mata yadra sa beitaki joseva vata kei rau, ka sa qaravi rau. e ratou s vesu tiko vakawawa.

source_text: and they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of egypt, which were bound in the prison.
target_text: o koya na dauvakarau waini kei koya na dauvavavi nei fero, e rau sa tadra ruarua, na nodrau tadra yadudua ena dua ga na bogi, ka duidui na kena i balebale.

source_text: and joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
target_text: sa lako mai vei rau o joseva ena mataka, ka raici rau, sa raica ni rau sa rarawa sara vakalevu.

source_text: and he asked pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, wherefore look ye so sadly to day?
target_text: sa tarogi rau sara ka vaka: "na cava drau sa rui rarawa kina vakalevu ena siga oqo? "

source_text: and they said unto him, we have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. and joseph said unto them, do not interpretations belong to god? tell me them, i pray you.
target_text: e rau sa tukuna vua, "keirau sa dui tadra na tadra e duidui, ka sa sega na kena i vakavakadewa. " sa tukuna o joseva, "sa sega beka ni nona ga na kalou na vakavakadewa? drau tukuna mai vei au. "

source_text: and the chief butler told his dream to joseph, and said to him, in my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
target_text: nai liuliu ni dauvakarau waini sa tukuna vei joseva na nona tadra ka vaka: "ena noqu tadra, sa tu e mataqu e dua na vaini,

source_text: and in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
target_text: "na vaini oqo sa tolu na tabana, sa kubu mai, sa vakadrauna sara, sa se ka kauta mai na vuana sa dreu tu.

source_text: and pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and i took the grapes, and pressed them into pharaoh's cup, and i gave the cup into pharaoh's hand.
target_text: "sa tu e ligaqu na bula nei fero, au sa taura na vaini dreu ka lobaka ena bilo nei fero, ka au sa kauta sara na bilo ka solia ena ligai fero. "

source_text: and joseph said unto him, this is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days:
target_text: sa tukuna vua o joseva, "oqo na kena i vakavakadewa, na tolu na tabana sa tolu na siga.

source_text: yet within three days shall pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
target_text: "ena tolu na siga oqo, o fero ena laveti iko cake tale, ka vakatikori iko lesu tale ki na nomu i tutu, ka o na dau soli mena gunu tale na fero me vaka ga o sa dau cakava e liu.

source_text: but think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, i pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
target_text: "mo qai nanumi au mai ni o sa tiko vinaka, ka mo vakaraitaka vei au na nomu yalovinaka; mo dau tukuni au vei fero, ka mo kauti au tani mai na vale oqo.

source_text: for indeed i was stolen away out of the land of the hebrews: and here also have i done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
target_text: "ni sa ka dina, na noqu kau tani mai vakaukauwa mai na nodra vanua na iperiu; au sa sega talega ni cakava e dua na ka e ganita na noqu mai tu oqo. "

source_text: when the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto joseph, i also was in my dream, and, behold, i had three white baskets on my head:
target_text: ni sa raica na i liuliu ni dau vavavi ni sa vinaka nai vakamacala nei joseva, sa tukuna sara yani, "o au talega, ena noqu tadra, sa tolu na i su vulavula e uluqu.

source_text: and in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
target_text: "nai su sa tiko duadua e cake, sa tiko kina na veikakana vavi me kei fero, era sa mai kania na manumanu vuka, mai na uluqu. "

source_text: and joseph answered and said, this is the interpretation thereof: the three baskets are three days:
target_text: sa sauma vua o joseva ka vaka: "oqo na kena i balebale, e tolu na i su, sa tolu na siga.

source_text: yet within three days shall pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
target_text: "ena tolu na siga oqo, o fero ena vakaliliga na domomu ena dua na vunikau, mai kea, era na kania kina na lewemu na manumanu vuka. "

source_text: and it came to pass the third day, which was pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
target_text: sa qai yaco ena i ka tolu ni siga, na siga talega ni vakananumi ni sucu nei fero, sa cakava kina e dua na kakana levu vei ira na nona dauveiqaravi; sa vakaturi rau cake na nona i liuliu ni daucaka waini kei koya nai liuliu ni dau vavavi e matadra na dauveiqaravi.

source_text: and he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into pharaoh's hand:
target_text: sa vakatikora lesu na nona dau caka waini, ka sa dau biuta na waini ena ligai fero.

source_text: but he hanged the chief baker: as joseph had interpreted to them.
target_text: sa vakakukunataki koya na dau vavavi, me vaka nai vakamacala nei joseva vei rau.

source_text: yet did not the chief butler remember joseph, but forgat him.
target_text: nai liuliu ni dau vakarau waini sa sega ni nanumi joseva, ka sa guilecavi koya.

source_text: and it came to pass at the end of two full years, that pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
target_text: ni sa oti vinaka e rua na yabaki, sa tadra o fero; ni sa tucake tu ena dua na bati ni uciwai.

source_text: and, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
target_text: vakasauri e ratou sa basika mai wai e vitu na bulumakau rairai vinaka ka levulevu, ka era sa mai kakana voli.

source_text: and, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
target_text: era sa muri tale mai e vitu tale na bulumakau lila ka rairai ca, ka ra sa mai tu talega ena bati ni uciwai.

source_text: and the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. so pharaoh awoke.
target_text: o ira na ka lila rairai ca oqo, era sa kani ira na ka levulevu ka rairai vinaka oqo: sa yadra sara o fero.

source_text: and he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
target_text: sa moce tale, ka tadra ena i karua ni gauna, ni sa basika e vitu na sila mai na dua ga na vuna, sa bulabula ka rairai vinaka.

source_text: and, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
target_text: sa basika tale mai e vitu na sila raqosa ka matemate, ena kena liwa mai na tokalau.

source_text: and the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. and pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
target_text: na vitu na sila raqosa sa tiloma na vitu na sila bulabula ka vinaka oqo. sa yadra o fero, ka qai kila, ni sa tadra walega.

source_text: and it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto pharaoh.
target_text: ena mataka o ya, sa leqa vakalevu tiko na yaloi fero, sa talatala yani me ra lako mai vua na dau caka i sausau kece e ijipita kei ira kece na tamata vuku. sa tukuna vei ira o fero na nona tadra, ia, sa sega e dua me vakamacalataka rawa na kena i balebale vei fero.

source_text: then spake the chief butler unto pharaoh, saying, i do remember my faults this day:
target_text: sa qai vosa vei fero nai liuliu ni dauvakarau waini ka tukuna, "ena siga oqo, au sa qai kila kina na noqu cala.

source_text: pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard's house, both me and the chief baker:
target_text: "ena gauna sa cudru kina o fero vei rau na nona tamata, o au kei koya na dauvavavi, ka keirau sa tu vakavesu,

source_text: and we dreamed a dream in one night, i and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
target_text: "keirau sa dui tadra yadudua ena dua ga na bogi. sa tu ga na i vakavakadewa ni neirau dui tadra.

source_text: and there was there with us a young man, an hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret.
target_text: "sa dua na cauravou ni iperiu sa tiko vata kei keda, e nona dauveiqaravi na i liuliu ni mata yadra. keirau sa tukuna vua na neirau tadra, ka sa vakabalebaletaka vei keirau na neirau tadra.

source_text: and it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.
target_text: "sa yaco me vaka sa vakabalebaletaka vei keirau. au sa vakatikori lesu tale, o koya ka dua sa vakakukunataki. "

source_text: then pharaoh sent and called joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto pharaoh.
target_text: sa talatala o fero me kau mai o joseva, era sa kauti koya mai vakatotolo. era sa vakasavasavataki koya, toro na kumina ka veisau na nona i sulu ka kau mai vei fero.

source_text: and pharaoh said unto joseph, i have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and i have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.
target_text: sa tukuna vua o fero, "au a tadra e dua na tadra, sa sega ni dua me tukuna vei au na kena i balebale. au sa rogoca ni o iko, e rawa ni o vakaibalebaletaka na tadra. "

source_text: and joseph answered pharaoh, saying, it is not in me: god shall give pharaoh an answer of peace.
target_text: sa vosa o joseva vei fero ka vaka: "sa sega ni o au, na kalou ga, ena rawa ni sauma vei fero ena vakacegu. "

source_text: and pharaoh said unto joseph, in my dream, behold, i stood upon the bank of the river:
target_text: sa qai tukuna o fero na nona tadra vei joseva, "raica, ena noqu tadra, au sa tucake tu ena bati ni uciwai.

source_text: and, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favoured; and they fed in a meadow:
target_text: "vakasauri, e ratou sa lako mai wai e vitu na bulumakau bulabula ka rairai vinaka, ka e ratou sa mai kakana voli.

source_text: and, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favoured and leanfleshed, such as i never saw in all the land of egypt for badness:
target_text: "e ratou sa lako tale mai e vitu tale na bulumakau bulabula ka rairai vinaka, ka e ratou sa mai kakana voli.

source_text: and the lean and the ill favoured kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:
target_text: "era sa kani iratou na lewe vitu bulabula rairai vinaka ka basika e liu.

source_text: and when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill favoured, as at the beginning. so i awoke.
target_text: "ni ratou sa kana oti, e sega sara ga ni kilai ni ratou kania e dua na ka, baleta ni ratou rairai tuga vaka e liu. oqo sa vakayadrati au.

source_text: and i saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good:
target_text: "au sa raica talega ena noqu tadra, e vitu na sila vinaka ka bulabula sa basika mai na dua na vuna.

source_text: and, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
target_text: "raica sa vitu talega na sila, lila ka raqosa, sa kauta mai na cagi tokalau sa basika cake talega mai.

source_text: and the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and i told this unto the magicians; but there was none that could declare it to me.
target_text: "na sila lila, raqosa malai oqo, sa tilomi ira na ka bulabula rairai vinaka. au sa vakamacalataka oqo vei ira na kila ka, sa sega ni dua e vakaibalebaletaka rawa vei au. "

source_text: and joseph said unto pharaoh, the dream of pharaoh is one: god hath shewed pharaoh what he is about to do.
target_text: sa tukuna o joseva vei fero, "sa dua ga na tadra nei fero, na kalou sa vakaraitaka vei fero na veika sa vakarau me cakava:

source_text: the seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one.
target_text: "na vitu na bulumakau, sa vitu na yabaki, na vitu na sila vinaka, sa vitu na yabaki vinaka â€œsa dua ga na tadra.

source_text: and the seven thin and ill favoured kine that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind shall be seven years of famine.
target_text: "na vitu na bulumakau lila matemate sa muri mai, oqori sa vitu na yabaki kei na cagi tokalau, sa vitu na yabaki ni dausiga.

source_text: this is the thing which i have spoken unto pharaoh: what god is about to do he sheweth unto pharaoh.
target_text: "oqo na veika au sa tukuna vei fero. na kalou sa vakaraitaka vei fero na veika ena vakarau cakava.

source_text: behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of egypt:
target_text: "raica, ena liu mai na vitu na yabaki ni sautu ena vanua taucoko e ijipita;

source_text: and there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
target_text: "ni oti o ya, ena lako mai na vitu na yabaki ni via kana. ena guilecavi na vitu na yabaki vinaka ena vanua o ijipita, na dausiga ena vakarusa na vanua.

source_text: and the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it shall be very grievous.
target_text: "na sautu ena guilecavi ena vanua, baleta ni sa lako mai na dausiga, ena ca vakalevu sara.

source_text: and for that the dream was doubled unto pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by god, and god will shortly bring it to pass.
target_text: "sa tokaruataki vei fero nai balebale ni tadra, baleta na kalou sa vakadeitaka, na kalou ga ena vakayacora dina.

source_text: now therefore let pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of egypt.
target_text: "oqo, me qai digitaka o fero e dua na tamata vuku ka rai yawa, me qarava na ka oqo ena vanua o ijipita.

source_text: let pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of egypt in the seven plenteous years.
target_text: "me cakava o fero oqo, me digitaki ira nai vakalesilesi ena vanua taucoko, me ra kumuna mai e dua nai kalima na vua ni qele e ijipita ena yabaki ni sautu oqo.

source_text: and let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn under the hand of pharaoh, and let them keep food in the cities.
target_text: "me ra sa kumuna mai na kakana ena vei yabaki vinaka oqo, ka biuta tiko ena i lololo ena lewa vakalawa i fero, ka me ra maroroi tiko ena vei koro lelevu.

source_text: and that food shall be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of egypt; that the land perish not through the famine.
target_text: "na lololo ni kakana oqo me ra tu vakarau tu ni sa basika mai na dausiga o koya ena tarai ijipita mai, me kua ni leqa kina oijipita ni sa yaco mai na dausiga. "

source_text: and the thing was good in the eyes of pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
target_text: nai vakasala mai vei joseva, sa vinaka vei fero kei ira kece nai vakalesilesi.

source_text: and pharaoh said unto his servants, can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom the spirit of god is?
target_text: sa tukuna o fero vei ira na dauveiqaravi, "e rawa beka ni da kunea e dua na tamata vaka oqo, na tamata sa tu vua na yalo ni kalou? "

source_text: and pharaoh said unto joseph, forasmuch as god hath shewed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art:
target_text: sa tukuna o fero vei joseva, "me vaka sa vakaraitaka oqo vei iko na kalou, sa sega tale e dua me rai yawa ka vuku me vakataki iko.

source_text: thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will i be greater than thou.
target_text: "o na lewa na noqu vale kei ira na noqu tamata era na lewai ena nomu vosa, ena i tikotiko vakaturaga ga, au na liu tiko kina vei iko. "

source_text: and pharaoh said unto joseph, see, i have set thee over all the land of egypt.
target_text: sa tukuna o fero vei joseva, "raica au sa solia vei iko na lewa ena vanua taucoko o ijipita. "

source_text: and pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon joseph's hand, and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck;
target_text: sa taura na nona mama ni lewa cecere o ijipita ka vakacuruma e ligai joseva, ka vakasulumi koya ena i oro bale lineni matailalai kei nai taube koula e domona.

source_text: and he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before him, bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of egypt.
target_text: sa vakavodoki joseva ena i karua ni qiqi vakatui, ka era sa kaciva yani "mo ni tekiduru! " sa vakatikori koya me lewa taucoko e ijipita.

source_text: and pharaoh said unto joseph, i am pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of egypt.
target_text: sa tukuna talega o fero vei joseva, "o au o fero, ena nomu lewa ga, ena qai tara kina vua e dua me laveta na ligana se yavana ena vanua taucoko o ijipita. "

source_text: and pharaoh called joseph's name zaphnathpaaneah; and he gave him to wife asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of on. and joseph went out over all the land of egypt.
target_text: o fero sa vakayacani joseva me sefanacipaenaca. sa solia vua e dua na watina, na yacana o asenaca na luvei poti-fera na bete mai oni. sa lako yani o joseva ki na vanua taucoko o ijipita.

source_text: and joseph was thirty years old when he stood before pharaoh king of egypt. and joseph went out from the presence of pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of egypt.
target_text: sa yabaki tolusagavulu o joseva ni sa tu ena matai fero na tui ijipita. sa lako tani mai na mata i fero ka lako yani ki ijipita taucoko.

source_text: and in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls.
target_text: ena vitu na yabaki ni sautu, sa vuavuai dina na vanua e ijipita.

source_text: and he gathered up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every city, laid he up in the same.
target_text: sa kumuna kece mai na kakana, ena vitu na yabaki ni sautu e ijipita, ka binia ena veikoro lelevu na kakana mai na veivanua volivolita.

source_text: and joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.
target_text: sa kumuna mai na sila o joseva, sa vaka na nuku ni matasawa, me yacova ga ni ra sa sega ni wiliki rawa.

source_text: and unto joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came, which asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of on bare unto him.
target_text: sa vakasucumi vei joseva e rua na luvena tagane ni bera na dausiga mai vei asenaca na luvei poti-fera na bete mai oni.

source_text: and joseph called the name of the firstborn manasseh: for god, said he, hath made me forget all my toil, and all my father's house.
target_text: o joseva sa vakayacani koya na ulumatua me o manasa, "ni kalou sa vakavuna me'u guilecava na noqu oca kei na noqu vuvale. "

source_text: and the name of the second called he ephraim: for god hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
target_text: sa vakayacani koya nai karua me o ifereimi, "ni kalou sa vakavuna me'u vuavuai ena vanua ni noqu rarawa. "

source_text: and the seven years of plenteousness, that was in the land of egypt, were ended.
target_text: sa mai cava na vitu na yabaki ni sautu ena vanua o ijipita,

source_text: and the seven years of dearth began to come, according as joseph had said: and the dearth was in all lands; but in all the land of egypt there was bread.
target_text: sa tekivu me basika mai na veiyabaki ni dausiga, me vaka sa tukuna o joseva. na dausiga oqo sa tara na vanua taucoko, mai ijipita ga sa tiko kina na madrai.

source_text: and when all the land of egypt was famished, the people cried to pharaoh for bread: and pharaoh said unto all the egyptians, go unto joseph; what he saith to you, do.
target_text: na vanua taucoko sa tarai ira na dausiga, ka era sa tagi vei fero me so na kedra madrai. sa tukuna vei ira o fero, "ni lako vei joseva, na veika ga sa tukuna vei kemuni mo ni qai cakava. "

source_text: and the famine was over all the face of the earth: and joseph opened all the storehouses, and sold unto the egyptians; and the famine waxed sore in the land of egypt.
target_text: sa tarai vuravura taucoko na dausiga oqo. o joseva sa dolava na lololo kece ka volivolitaki vei ira na ijipita. sa qai ca ga mai na dausiga e ijipita.

source_text: and all countries came into egypt to joseph for to buy corn; because that the famine was so sore in all lands.
target_text: na veivanua kece, era sa lako mai vei joseva e ijipita, me ra voli sila, baleta na dausiga sa sivia ena vanua kecega.

source_text: now when jacob saw that there was corn in egypt, jacob said unto his sons, why do ye look one upon another?
target_text: ni sa kila o jekope ni sa tu na sila mai ijipita, sa tukuna vei iratou na luvena, "na cava dou sa veiraici tiko kina? "

source_text: and he said, behold, i have heard that there is corn in egypt: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
target_text: au sa rogoca ni sa tiko na sila mai ijipita, "dou lako sobu ka volivoli mai ena vukuda me da bula kina. "

source_text: and joseph's ten brethren went down to buy corn in egypt.
target_text: o iratou na lewe tini na taci joseva, e ratou sa lako sobu i ijipita me voli sila.

source_text: but benjamin, joseph's brother, jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, lest peradventure mischief befall him.
target_text: o jekope sa sega ni vakatalai penijamini na taci joseva vata kei ira na tacina, ni sa tukuna, "de qai yacovi koya e dua na leqa. "

source_text: and the sons of israel came to buy corn among those that came: for the famine was in the land of canaan.
target_text: o iratou na luvei isireli e ratou sa la'ki voli sila vata kei ira na tamata, ni sa levu na dausiga e kenani.

source_text: and joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the people of the land: and joseph's brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth.
target_text: o joseva sa kovana levu ena vanua, ni sai koya ga sa volivolitaki tiko ena vanua. e ratou sa lako mai na tacina ka cuva e matana.

source_text: and joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them, whence come ye? and they said, from the land of canaan to buy food.
target_text: sa raici iratou o joseva ka sa kilai iratou, sa vuki ga me vaka na vulagi vei iratou ka vosa tiko vakaukauwa vei iratou. sa mani tarogi iratou, "dou lako tiko mai vei? " e ratou sa sauma mai, "mai kenani me voli kakana. "

source_text: and joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
target_text: sa kilai iratou na tacina o joseva, ia, o iratou e sega e ratou sega ni kilai koya.

source_text: and joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
target_text: sa nanuma sara o joseva na tadra e a tadra me baleti iratou, ka tukuna vei iratou, "dou sa yamata vuni mai! dou sa lako mai me raica na lala tu ni vanua! "

source_text: and they said unto him, nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy servants come.
target_text: e ratou sa tukuna vei joseva, "e sega neitou turaga, keitou sa lako me voli kakana ga.

source_text: we are all one man's sons; we are true men, thy servants are no spies.
target_text: "keitou sa luvena kecega e dua na tamata, keitou sa tamata dina keitou sa sega ni yamata. "

source_text: and he said unto them, nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
target_text: sa tukuna tiko ga o koya, "e sega dou sa lako mai me vakaraica lo na vanua. "

source_text: and they said, thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
target_text: e ratou sa tukuna, "keitou na nomuni tamata sa lewe tinikarua na veitacini, na luve ni dua na tamata ena vanua o kenani; o koya e gone duadua sa tiko ga kei tamai keitou, ia, e dua tale sa sega. "

source_text: and joseph said unto them, that is it that i spake unto you, saying, ye are spies:
target_text: sa tukuna tiko ga o joseva, "o au sa vosa tiko vei kemudou ka tukuna, 'dou sa yamata vuni! '

source_text: hereby ye shall be proved: by the life of pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither.
target_text: "oqo dou sa na vakatovolei, me vaka sa bula o fero, dou na sega ni biuta na vanua vakavo, kevaka sa kau mai o koya e gone duadua.

source_text: send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proved, whether there be any truth in you: or else by the life of pharaoh surely ye are spies.
target_text: "dou vakatala e dua vei kemudou, me la'ki kauti tacina mai, na kena vo, dou na tiko e vale ni veivesu, me na kilai kina na dina sa tu vei kemudou; kevaka e sega, me vaka sa bula o fero â€œdou sa yamata vuni dina! "

source_text: and he put them all together into ward three days.
target_text: sa biuti iratou kece ki vale ni veivesu me tolu na siga.

source_text: and joseph said unto them the third day, this do, and live; for i fear god:
target_text: sa tukuna vei iratou o joseva e nai katolu ni siga, "dou cakava oqo, mo dou bula, ni'u sa rerevaka na kalou:

source_text: if ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison: go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses:
target_text: "kevaka dou sa tamata dina, me dua vei kemudou me vesu tiko, dou lako ka kauta na kakana ni sa levu na dausiga ena nomudou vanua.

source_text: but bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. and they did so.
target_text: "me kau mai na tacimudou gone duadua vei au: me vakadinadinataki kina na nomudou vosa, dou na sega ni mate kina. " e ratou sa cakava vakakina.

source_text: and they said one to another, we are verily guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
target_text: e ratou sa veitukunayaka, "e datou sa cala dina ena vuku i tacidatou, ni datou sa raica na via bula ena yalona, ni sa vakamasuti kedatou, e datou sa sega ga ni via rogoci koya; o koya oqo sa lakovi kedatou mai kina na veilecayaki levu oqo. "

source_text: and reuben answered them, saying, spake i not unto you, saying, do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore, behold, also his blood is required.
target_text: sa sauma yani vei iratou o rupeni ka vaka: "e sega beka ni'u a tukuna vei kemudou, 'mo dou kua ni valavala ca ena vuku ni gone; ' ia, dou sa sega ni via vakarorogo? ia, oqo na nona dra sa tarogi mai vei kedatou. "

source_text: and they knew not that joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter.
target_text: e ratou sega ni kila ni sa kila o joseva na veika oqo â€œni sa vosa tikoga vei iratou mai vua na dau vakavakadewa.

source_text: and he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them simeon, and bound him before their eyes.
target_text: sa vuki tani mai vei iratou ka tagi. sa qai dau lesu tale mai vei iratou ka vosa tale vei iratou. sa tauri simione mai ka vesuki koya e matadratou.

source_text: then joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he unto them.
target_text: sa solia nai vakaro o joseva me vakatawani kece na nodra dui taga ena sila, me vakalesui tale na nodra i lavo ki na nodra dui taga, me soli talega na kedra i vaqa, e nai lakolako lesu. sa vakayacori me vakakina.

source_text: and they laded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.
target_text: era sa vakavodoka na nodra dui asa ena sila ka lako yani mai kea.

source_text: and as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money; for, behold, it was in his sack's mouth.
target_text: ia, sa dua vei ira, sa dolava na nona taga me vakania na nona asa ena sila ena nodra mai cegu tiko, sa raica nai lavo ena gusu ni nona taga.

source_text: and he said unto his brethren, my money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, what is this that god hath done unto us?
target_text: sa tukuna sara yani vei ira na tacina, "na noqu i lavo sa vakasukai tale mai vei au, sa tu oqo ena noqu taga! " era sa rere vakalevu ka veitukuniyaka, "na cava sa cakava vei keda oqo na kalou? "

source_text: and they came unto jacob their father unto the land of canaan, and told him all that befell unto them; saying,
target_text: era sa lako vei tamadra o jekope, ena vanua o kenani ka tukuna vua na veika sa yaco ka vaka:

source_text: the man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
target_text: "na nodra turaga ena vanua, sa vosa vakaukauwa vei keitou, ka tukuna ni keitou sa lako yani me raica lo na vanua.

source_text: and we said unto him, we are true men; we are no spies:
target_text: "keitou sa tukuna vua, 'ni keitou sa vosa dina ka sega ni yamata vuni.

source_text: we be twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of canaan.
target_text: 'keitou sa lewe tinikarua ka dua ga na tamai keitou, e dua sa oti yani kei koya e gone duadua sa tiko vata kei tamai keitou ena siga oqo, ena vanua o kenani. '

source_text: and the man, the lord of the country, said unto us, hereby shall i know that ye are true men; leave one of your brethren here with me, and take food for the famine of your households, and be gone:
target_text: "na turaga ni vanua sa tukuna vei keitou, 'ena ka oqo au na kila kina ni dou sa dina, me biu tiko mai e ke e dua vei kemudou, dou kauta yani na kakana ni dausiga me kedra na nomudou vuvale, ka lako.

source_text: and bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall i know that ye are no spies, but that ye are true men: so will i deliver you your brother, and ye shall traffick in the land.
target_text: 'dou kauta lesu mai na tacimudou gone duadua vei au, me'u kila dina kina ni dou sa sega ni yamata vuni, ka sa tukuna na ka dina. au na qai soli tacimudou yani ka veivoli talega ena vanua. '"

source_text: and it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack: and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
target_text: sa yaco, ni ratou sa sova yani na nodratou dui taga â€œera sa dui kurabui ni sa tu na nodra dui taga i lavo ena nodra taga ni sila yadudua. ni ra sa raica nai lavo kei tamadra talega, era sa sa rere vakalevu.

source_text: and jacob their father said unto them, me have ye bereaved of my children: joseph is not, and simeon is not, and ye will take benjamin away: all these things are against me.
target_text: sa tukuna vei ira o jekope, "dou sa vakayalolailaitaki au ena vuku ni luvequ. sa yali o joseva, sa yali o simione, oqo dou sa via kauti penijamini tani. na veika kece oqo sa veicoqacoqa kei au. "

source_text: and reuben spake unto his father, saying, slay my two sons, if i bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and i will bring him to thee again.
target_text: sa vosa o rupeni vei tamana ka tukuna, "vakamatei rau na luvequ tagane kevaka au sega ni kauti koya lesu tale mai vei iko; biuti koya e ligaqu â€œau na kauti koya lesu tale mai vei iko. "

source_text: and he said, my son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o jekope, "na luvequ ena sega ni lako sobu kei kemudou, sa mate oti o tacina, sa vo duadua ga o koya. kevaka ena yacovi koya e dua na ka ena sala dou na lakova, dou na kauta sobu na ulu sika oqo ena rarawa ki nai bulubulu. "

source_text: and the famine was sore in the land.
target_text: sa ca vakalevu sara na dausiga ena vanua.

source_text: and it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of egypt, their father said unto them, go again, buy us a little food.
target_text: sa yaco, ni ra sa kania oti na sila sa kau mai ijipita, sa tukuna vei ira o tamadra, "dou lesu tale ka volia tale mai na kakana. "

source_text: and judah spake unto him, saying, the man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
target_text: sa vosa vua o juta, "raica sa vosa vei keitou na tamata, 'dou kua tale ni raica na mataqu, vakavo ke sa lako mai na tacimudou gone duadua. '

source_text: if thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
target_text: "kevaka o sa vakatala vata kei keitou na taci keitou, keitou na qai lako sobu ka voli kakana.

source_text: but if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
target_text: "kevaka e sega, keitou na sega ni lako sobu: ni sa tukuna vei keitou na tamata, dou na sega ni raica na mataqu, vakavo, ke sa lako mai na tacimudou. '"

source_text: and israel said, wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
target_text: sa tukuna o isireli, "ena cava dou sa cakacaka vakaca kina vei au, ni dou sa tukuna vua na tamata ni se tiko tale e dua na tacimudou? "

source_text: and they said, the man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, bring your brother down?
target_text: e ratou sa tukuna, "na tamata sa vakatarogi keitou vakalalai kei ira talega na wekai keitou ka vaka: 'e se bula tiko o tamamudou? e dua tale tiko na tacimudou? ' keitou sa sauma vua me vaka na nona taro. keitou sa sega ni kila ni na tukuna mai, 'me kau sobu mai o tacimudou'? "

source_text: and judah said unto israel his father, send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones.
target_text: sa tukuna o juta vei isireli na tamana, "mo vakatalai koya vata kei au, me keitou lako me da bula kina ka sega ni mate, o iko kei ira na lalai.

source_text: i will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if i bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:
target_text: "o au, nai vakadei ni nona lako, mo na tarogi koya mai na ligaqu. kevaka au na sega ni kauti koya lesu mai vei iko ka biuti koya e matamu. me'u qai beitaki kina me sega ni mudu.

source_text: for except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time.
target_text: "kevaka keitou a sega ni vakaberabera tiko, e dodonu me keitou sa lesu tale mai vakarua oqo. "

source_text: and their father israel said unto them, if it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spices, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:
target_text: sa qai tukuna vei iratou o isireli na tamadratou, "kevaka sa dina oqori, dou cakava oqo â€œdou kauta na vuata vinaka duadua ni vanua ena nomudou taga ka vakacabora vua na tamata, so talega na waiwai boivinaka, vakalailai na oni, na i waki ni kakana, na pinati lalai kei na pinati lelevu.

source_text: and take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry it again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight:
target_text: "me vakaruataki nai lavo mo dou kauta me kau lesu nai lavo e kune ena nomudou taga, de a sega ni nakiti.

source_text: take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
target_text: "dou kauti tacimudou talega, ka lako yani vua na tamata.

source_text: and god almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may send away your other brother, and benjamin. if i be bereaved of my children, i am bereaved.
target_text: "na kalou me vakaraitaka na yalololoma vua na tamata me rawa ni sereki tacimudou kei penijamini, kevaka me'u sa sega ni lomani, sa na vakakina ga! "

source_text: and the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and benjamin; and rose up, and went down to egypt, and stood before joseph.
target_text: e ratou sa tucake na tamata ka lako yani ki ijipita ka tu ena mata i joseva kei nai yau vakayadua e a vakarautaki.

source_text: and when joseph saw benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house, bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these men shall dine with me at noon.
target_text: o joseva, ni sa raici penijamini vata kei iratou na tacina, sa tukuna vua na nona tamata, "kauti iratou oqo ki noqu vale. vakamatea e dua na manumanu ka vakarautaka rawa, o ira oqo era na kana vata kei au ena siga levu. "

source_text: and the man did as joseph bade; and the man brought the men into joseph's house.
target_text: era sa cakava na tamata me vaka sa vakarota o joseva. e ratou sa kau sara kina vale nei joseva.

source_text: and the men were afraid, because they were brought into joseph's house; and they said, because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.
target_text: era sa rere na tamata ni ra sa kau sara ki na vale nei joseva, e ratou sa tukuna, "oqo sa baleta nai lavo sa tiko ena nodatou taga sila ena i matai ni lako mai, oqo sa vakasaqara e dua na ka, me rawa ni beitaki kedatou kina ka me qai tauri kedatou me nona bobula. "

source_text: and they came near to the steward of joseph's house, and they communed with him at the door of the house,
target_text: ni ratou sa toso voleka yani vua na dauveiqaravi ni vale nei joseva, era sa veivosaki sara ena mata ni katuba,

source_text: and said, o sir, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:
target_text: ka tukuna, "io, saka, keimami a lako mai ena i matai ni gauna me voli kakana;

source_text: and it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.
target_text: "sa yaco ni keimami sa lesu tale, keimami sa kunea na i lavo ena gusu ni neimami taga. nai lavo o ya, keimami sa kauta lesu tale tiko mai oqo e ligai keimami.

source_text: and other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.
target_text: "keimami sa kauta tale tikoga mai eso na i lavo me voli kakana kina â€œkeimami sa sega ga ni kila se o cei e biuta nai lavo ena neimami taga. "

source_text: and he said, peace be to you, fear not: your god, and the god of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: i had your money. and he brought simeon out unto them.
target_text: ia, sa tukuna mai, "mo dou vakacegu ka kua ni rere, na nomudou kalou kei na kalou ni tamamudou sa solia nai yau ka biuta ena nomudou taga, sa tu vei au na nomudou i lavo. " sa sereki simione lesu vei iratou.

source_text: and the man brought the men into joseph's house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.
target_text: na dauveiqaravi sa kauti iratou mai ki vale, solia na wai me ratou vuluvulu kina kei na yavadratou talega ka solia na ka me ra kania na asa.

source_text: and they made ready the present against joseph came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.
target_text: era sa vakarautaka sara nai solisoli, ni na basika mai o joseva ena siga levu â€œni ra sa rogoca ni na mai kana madrai e kea.

source_text: and when joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed themselves to him to the earth.
target_text: ni sa lako mai i vale o joseva, era sa kauta mai nai solisoli loloma ena ligadra ki vale, ka era sa cuva sobu vua ki na qele.

source_text: and he asked them of their welfare, and said, is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? is he yet alive?
target_text: sa tarogi ira sara me baleta na nodra bula vinaka ka vaka: "e vinaka tiko beka o tamamudou, na qase dou a tukuna tiko? e se bula tiko o koya? "

source_text: and they answered, thy servant our father is in good health, he is yet alive. and they bowed down their heads, and made obeisance.
target_text: e ratou sa sauma mai, "na nomuni tamata na tamai keitou e se bula vinaka tiko ka bulabula talega. " era sa cuva sobu ka vakarokoroko.

source_text: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother benjamin, his mother's son, and said, is this your younger brother, of whom ye spake unto me? and he said, god be gracious unto thee, my son.
target_text: sa rai cake ka raici penijamini, na luvei tinana ka taroga, "oqo beka na tacimudou gone dou a tukuna vei au? " sa tukuna tale, "me yalololoma vei iko na kalou na luvequ. "

source_text: and joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.
target_text: sa luluvu na yalona ena vukui tacina, sa lako tani yani vakatotolo ka tagi e na nona rumu.

source_text: and he washed his face, and went out, and refrained himself, and said, set on bread.
target_text: sa tavoya na matana ka lako tale mai, sa tauri koya vinaka ka tukuna, "me soli yani na madrai. "

source_text: and they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the egyptians might not eat bread with the hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the egyptians.
target_text: sa vakarautaki ga na teveli taudua nei joseva, na tikina ga me ra kana kina na tacina, na nodra tikina na ijipita era veiqaravi â€œni o ira na ijipita era sega ni rawa ni kana vata kei ira na iperiu, ni oqo na ka toro sobu vei ira na kai ijipita.

source_text: and they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled one at another.
target_text: era dabe tuvai e matai joseva, mai vei koya e qaseduadua ki vei koya sara e gone duadua. e ratou sa veiraici mada ga ena kidroa na veitacini.

source_text: and he took and sent messes unto them from before him: but benjamin's mess was five times so much as any of theirs. and they drank, and were merry with him.
target_text: sa kauta yani o koya na veiqaravi vei ira, mai matana. sa vakalimataki na ka vei penijamini. era sa gunu ka marau vata tiko kei joseva.

source_text: and he commanded the steward of his house, saying, fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth.
target_text: sa vakaroti ira na veiqaravi ena nona vale ka tukuna, "vakatawana na kakana ena nodra taga na tamata, na kena levu ga e rawa ni ra kauta, me biu tale na nodra i lavo ena gusu ni nodra taga.

source_text: and put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and his corn money. and he did according to the word that joseph had spoken.
target_text: "me biu na noqu bilo siliva ena gusu ni nona taga o koya e gone duadua kei na nona i lavo talega ni sila. " sa caka me vaka na vosa sa tukuna o joseva.

source_text: as soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.
target_text: ni sa kida na mataka, era sa vakatalai yani na tamata kei na nodra asa.

source_text: and when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, joseph said unto his steward, up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?
target_text: ni ra sa lako tani yani mai na koro, ka e se bera sara na nodra lako yani vakayawa, sa tukuna o joseva vua na dauveiqaravi "tu cake, cici muri ira na tamata, ni o sa toboki ira, tukuna vaka oqo, 'na cava dou sa caka ca kina ena vuku ni vinaka?

source_text: is not this it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.
target_text: 'sa sega beka ni oqo na nona ka ni gunu na noqu turaga â€œoqo talega sa dau caka i sausau kina o koya, dou sa caka ca sara ena vuku ni ka oqo. '"

source_text: and he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.
target_text: sa toboki ira sara ka cavuta na veivosa oqori.

source_text: and they said unto him, wherefore saith my lord these words? god forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:
target_text: era sa tukuna vua, "na cava na vuna sa cavuta kina na vosa oqori na noqu turaga? me kua sara vei keimami na nomuni tamata na cakava na veika oqori.

source_text: behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord's house silver or gold?
target_text: "raica keimami sa kauta lesu tale mai, mai na vanua o kenani nai lavo sa kune ena neimami taga, kila rawa vakacava me keimami butakoca na siliva se koula mai na vale ni neimami turaga?

source_text: with whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord's bondmen.
target_text: "vei koya ena kune vua, me na vakamatei, ka keimami na wili me nona bobula na noqu turaga. "

source_text: and he said, now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.
target_text: sa tukuna na tamata, "sa na yaco me vaka na nomudou vosa, o koya sa na kune vua, ena noqu bobula, o kemudou dou na sega ni beitaki. "

source_text: then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.
target_text: era sa vakatotolo sara ka biuta kece ki ra na nodra dui usausa, ka dolava na nodra dui taga.

source_text: and he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in benjamin's sack.
target_text: sa tekivu mai vua sa qase ki vua sara sa gone: na bilo sa kune ena taga nei penijamini.

source_text: then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the city.
target_text: era sa basuraka na nodra i sulu, ka era sa vakavodoka tale na nodra dui asa ka lesu ki na koro.

source_text: and judah and his brethren came to joseph's house; for he was yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.
target_text: o juta kei ira na tacina, era sa lako mai ki na vale nei joseva, (ni se tiko ga e vale) era sa cuva vua ki na qele.

source_text: and joseph said unto them, what deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as i can certainly divine?
target_text: sa tukuna vei ira o joseva. "na cava dou sa cakava oqo? dou sa sega beka ni kila ni tamata vakataki au, sa dau caka i sausau? "

source_text: and judah said, what shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? god hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.
target_text: sa tukuna yani o juta, "na cava me keitou tukuna vua na neitou turaga? na vosa cava? se me keitou vakagalalataki keitou vakacava? na kalou sa raica na neitou cala, sai keitou oqo â€œkeitou sa nona bobula na noqu turaga, oi keitou kei koya talega sa kune vua na bilo nei koya na noqu turaga. "

source_text: and he said, god forbid that i should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.
target_text: sa tukuna mai o joseva: "me kua sara vei au oqori, me'u cakava na ka vaka oqori, o koya ga sa kune vua na bilo, ena noqu bobula â€œvei kemudou, dou lako ena vakacegu vei tamamudou. "

source_text: then judah came near unto him, and said, oh my lord, let thy servant, i pray thee, speak a word in my lord's ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant: for thou art even as pharaoh.
target_text: sa toso voleka o juta vei joseva ka tukuna, "noqu turaga, me'u vosa mada ka mo ni vakarorogo, me kua ni katakata na nomuni cudru vua na nomuni tamata; ni kemuni sa vakataki fero ga.

source_text: my lord asked his servants, saying, have ye a father, or a brother?
target_text: "na noqu turaga sa taroga na nomuni tamata ka vaka, 'edua tiko na tamamudou, e dua tiko na tacimudou? '

source_text: and we said unto my lord, we have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.
target_text: "keitou sa sauma vua na turaga, 'sa tiko na tamai keitou ka sa qase sara, sa tiko talega na taci keitou, e luvei tamai keitou ni sa qase sara, e gone sara, sa mate o tacina, o koya ga na luvei tinana ka sa rui lomani koya vakalevu o tamana. '

source_text: and thou saidst unto thy servants, bring him down unto me, that i may set mine eyes upon him.
target_text: "o ni sa tukuna vei ira na nomuni tamata, 'me kau sobu mai me raici koya na matamuni. '

source_text: and we said unto my lord, the lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
target_text: "keimami sa tukuna vua na neimami turaga, 'na gone sa sega ni rawa ni biuti tamana, ena mate o tamana kevaka sa biuti koya na gone. '

source_text: and thou saidst unto thy servants, except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
target_text: "o ni sa tukuna vei ira na nomuni tamata, 'kevaka sa sega ni lako mai na gone, keimami na sega ni raici kemuni. '

source_text: and it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
target_text: "ni keimami sa lako vei tamai keimami, keimami sa tukuna vua na vosa nei koya na neimami turaga.

source_text: and our father said, go again, and buy us a little food.
target_text: "sa tukuna o tamai keimami, 'me keimami mai volia tale mada vakalailai na kakana. '

source_text: and we said, we cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man's face, except our youngest brother be with us.
target_text: "keimami sa tukuna, 'keimami na sega ni lako na sobu, vakavo kevaka sa lako vata kei keimami na gone. '

source_text: and thy servant my father said unto us, ye know that my wife bare me two sons:
target_text: "na tamadra na nomuni tamata sa tukuna, 'dou sa kila, na watiqu sa vakasucuma vei au e rua na luvequ tagane;

source_text: and the one went out from me, and i said, surely he is torn in pieces; and i saw him not since:
target_text: 'o koya sa lako tani mai vei au, "sa dina sara, sa basubasuki vakalalai"â€œau sa sega ni raici koya tale mai na siga o ya.

source_text: and if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
target_text: 'kevaka dou sa kauti koya tale oqo, ka yacovi koya na leqa, dou sa kauta sobu na ulu sika oqo ki nai bulubulu. '

source_text: now therefore when i come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life;
target_text: "o koya oqo, ni'u na lako vua na nomuni tamata na tamaqu, ka sa sega ni tiko vata kei keitou na gone, na nona bula sa vesuki vata tiko kei na nona bula na gone,

source_text: it shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.
target_text: "ena yaco ni sa raica sa sega vei keitou na gone, ena mate o koya. o keitou sa na beitaki ni kauta sobu ki nai bulubulu ena rarawa na ulu sika â€œna tamai keitou.

source_text: for thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, if i bring him not unto thee, then i shall bear the blame to my father for ever.
target_text: "o au, na nomuni tamata, sa yalayala mei vakadei me baleta na gone vei tamana. 'kevaka, au na sega ni kauta lesu mai na gone â€œsa na noqu na kena bili me sega ni mudu. '

source_text: now therefore, i pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.
target_text: "o koya oqo, me'u tiko o au na nomuni tamata ka me lako na gone, me'u nona bobula na noqu turaga â€œme lako ga yani na gone vata kei ira na tacina.

source_text: for how shall i go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure i see the evil that shall come on my father.
target_text: "me'u lako rawa vaka-cava vei tamaqu kevaka sa sega na gone, de, au na qai raica na rarawa levu ena lako mai vei tamaqu? "

source_text: then joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, cause every man to go out from me. and there stood no man with him, while joseph made himself known unto his brethren.
target_text: sa sega ni rawa ni vosoti koya tiko o joseva e matadra sa tu vata kei koya, ka sa kaci yani, "mera lako kece i tuba na tamata mai vei au! " sa sega e tu vata kei koya ni sa tukuni koya tiko vei ira na tacina.

source_text: and he wept aloud: and the egyptians and the house of pharaoh heard.
target_text: sa tagi vakadomoi levu o koya, o ira na ijipita kei ira na vuvale nei fero, era sa rogoca.

source_text: and joseph said unto his brethren, i am joseph; doth my father yet live? and his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.
target_text: sa tukuna o joseva vei ira na tacina, "o au o joseva, e se bula tiko o tamaqu? " era sa sega ni sauma rawa na tacina, ni ra sa kidacala e matana.

source_text: and joseph said unto his brethren, come near to me, i pray you. and they came near. and he said, i am joseph your brother, whom ye sold into egypt.
target_text: sa tukuna o joseva vei ira na tacina, "dou toso voleka mai vei au. " sa qai tukuna tale, "o au o joseva na tacimudou, o koya dou a volitaka mai ki ijipita.

source_text: now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for god did send me before you to preserve life.
target_text: "dou kua ni rarawa se cudruvi kemudou kina ni dou volitaki au mai ki ke; na kalou sa talai au mai e liu vei kemudou, me maroroi kina na bula.

source_text: for these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in the which there shall neither be earing nor harvest.
target_text: "ena rua na yabaki oqo sa sega kina na kakana ena vanua, ka sa tiko tale oqo e lima na yabaki ena sega kina na cukicuki se na tatamusuki.

source_text: and god sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.
target_text: "na kalou sa talai mai liu vei kemudou me maroroi na sautu ena vuravura, ka me vakabulai kemudou ena veisereki levu.

source_text: so now it was not you that sent me hither, but god: and he hath made me a father to pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and a ruler throughout all the land of egypt.
target_text: "ia, oqo sa sega ni oi kemudou sa talai au mai, na kalou ga, o koya sa cakava me'u tama vei fero, ka turaga ena nona vale taucoko ka lewa ena vanua taucoko o ijipita.

source_text: haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, thus saith thy son joseph, god hath made me lord of all egypt: come down unto me, tarry not:
target_text: "dou totolo ka lako cake vei tamaqu ka tukuna vua, 'sa tukuna vaka oqo o joseva na luvemu: "na kalou sa cakava me'u turaga levu duadua e ijipita taucoko, lako sobu mai vakatotolo â€œkua ni wawa tale.

source_text: and thou shalt dwell in the land of goshen, and thou shalt be near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children's children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:
target_text: "dou na mai tiko ena vanua o koseni, dou na mai tiko volekati au, o kemudou kei ira na luvemudou kei ira na luvena na luvemudou, na nomudou manumanu kei na ka kecega sa nomudou.

source_text: and there will i nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.
target_text: "mai kea au na vakarautaka vei kemudou, de o ni na qai dravudravua o kemuni kei na nomuni vuvale kece, ni se vo tiko oqo e lima na yabaki ni dausiga. "'

source_text: and, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you.
target_text: "mo dou kila, na matamudou kei na matai penijamini na taciqu, sa raica na gusuqu ni sa vosa tiko.

source_text: and ye shall tell my father of all my glory in egypt, and of all that ye have seen; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.
target_text: "dou tukuna vei tamaqu na noqu cecere e ijipita kei na veika kecega dou sa raica; mo dou vakatotolo kina ka kauta sobu mai na tamaqu e ke. "

source_text: and he fell upon his brother benjamin's neck, and wept; and benjamin wept upon his neck.
target_text: rau sa veimokomokoti kei penijamini na tacina ka veitagicaki.

source_text: moreover he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and after that his brethren talked with him.
target_text: sa reguci iratou kece na tacina ka veitagici, ni sa oti o ya, era sa veivosaki.

source_text: and the fame thereof was heard in pharaoh's house, saying, joseph's brethren are come: and it pleased pharaoh well, and his servants.
target_text: nai rogorogo ni veika oqo sa yaco sara ki na loma ni vale nei fero ka vaka: "o ira na taci joseva, era sa lako mai. " sa taleitaka o fero kei ira na nona tamata na ka oqo.

source_text: and pharaoh said unto joseph, say unto thy brethren, this do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of canaan;
target_text: sa tukuna o fero vei joseva, "tukuna vei ira na tacimu, 'dou vakatawana nai lakolako, ka lako ki kenani.

source_text: and take your father and your households, and come unto me: and i will give you the good of the land of egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land.
target_text: 'dou kauti tamamudou mai kei na nomudou vuvale ka lako mai vei au; au na soli vei kemuni na tikina vinaka duadua ena vanua o ijipita, o ni na kania na uro ni vanua.

source_text: now thou art commanded, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.
target_text: 'o ni sa vakaroti mo ni cakava oqo o mo ni kauta na qiqi vakavale me ra kau mai kina na gone kei tinadra ka mo ni kauti tamamuni talega mai.

source_text: also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of egypt is yours.
target_text: 'mo ni kua ni leqataka na veika e nomuni, baleta, ni na soli vei kemuni na vanua vinaka duadua e ijipita me nomuni. '"

source_text: and the children of israel did so: and joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.
target_text: o ira na luvei isireli era sa cakava oqo, me vaka sa tukuni vei ira, sa soli vei ira na qiqi vakavale me vaka nai vakaro i fero, sa soli talega vei ira na i vaqa ni lakolako.

source_text: to all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; but to benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.
target_text: sa solia vei ira kece, vei ira vakayadua na veisau ni nodra i sulu; vei penijamini ga sa solia kina e tolu na drau na tiki ni siliva kei na lima nai sulu ni veisau.

source_text: and to his father he sent after this manner; ten asses laden with the good things of egypt, and ten she asses laden with corn and bread and meat for his father by the way.
target_text: sa vakauta vei tamana na veika oqo, e tina na asa sa vakavodoki kina na veika vivinaka e ijipita, e tini na asa yalewa sa vakavodoki kina na sila, na madrai, kei na veikakana ni lakolako mai.

source_text: so he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, see that ye fall not out by the way.
target_text: sa vakatalai ira yani na tacina, ka era sa lako yani, ka sa tukuna vei ira, "dou raica me kua na leqa ena sala. "

source_text: and they went up out of egypt, and came into the land of canaan unto jacob their father,
target_text: era sa lako cake tani yani mai ijipita ka lako mai kina vanua o kenani vei jekope na tamadra.

source_text: and told him, saying, joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of egypt. and jacob's heart fainted, for he believed them not.
target_text: era sa tukuna vua, "o joseva e se bula tiko, e sa lewa tiko ena vanua taucoko o ijipita. " sa kidacala o jekope baleta ni sa sega ni vakabauti ira.
